scenes.location: THE NAKATOMI BUILDING, (LOS ANGELES) EVENIN LOS ANGELES
characters: BE DISARMED AT THIS LOCATION. TERMINATE SEQUENCE, (Y/N)
THE ESCALATORS TO THE GARAGE COME TO A STOP
SENDING DESKS, CHAIRS, PHONES, AND TYPEWRITERS
BLOWING OUT THE MACHINE GUN NEXT AND JAMES AND
THE LED READOUT ON THE SAFE

dialogues.speaker: 405 FREEWAY
dialogues.text: Christmas tinsel on the light poles.  We ARE LOOKING east Inglewood INTO the orange grid of L.A. at night when sudd we TILT UP TO CATCH the huge belly of a landing 747 -- th noise is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: The usual moment just after landing when you let out that of relief that you've made it in one piece.  As the plane to its gate, they stir, gather personal belongings.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOHN MCCLANE
dialogues.text: mid-thirties, good-looking, athletic and tired from his t He sits by the window.  His relief on landing is subtle, we NOTICE.  Suddenly, he hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like flying, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane turns, looks at the Babbit clone next to him.  Ca he tenses, holds his armrests in exaggerated fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, where'd you get that idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Ya wanna know the secret of successful air travel?  After you get where you're going, ya take off your shoes and socks. Then ya walk around on the rug barefoot and make fists with your toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fists with your toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not a fist when it's your toes...I mean like this...work out that time zone tension. (demonstrating) Better'n a cup of coffee and a hot shower for the old jet lag.  I know it sounds crazy.  Trust me.  I've been doing it for nine years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane stops.  Passengers rise, start to take down ove luggage.  McClane does this, but as he opens the door abo the businessman BLANCHES seeing:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE'S BARETTA PISTOL
dialogues.text: Peeking out from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: 3-B BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Recognizing the look, McClane smiles reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. (showing badge) I'm a cop. (pause) Trust me.  I've been doing it for eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessman relaxes, moves off.  McClane now wrestles the biggest Teddy Bear FAO Schwartz had to offer.  Balanc this, he moves down to another overhead, takes out a topc and an overnighter.  Barely managing all this, he turns,

dialogues.speaker: 3-C A PRETTY STEWARDESS
dialogues.text: She bumps noses with the bear, gives a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, about the bear) Maybe you should have bought her a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrutinizes the nether regions of the bear, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't complain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eying him) Neither would I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane smiles, with just enough of a sigh to know he's a wistful about things-that-might-have-been as she is...mov down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A bottle of Dom Perignon as the cork explodes ac a large office floor decorated for Christmas.  A Japanese mid-fifties standing on a desk holds up the bottle triump and looks out at an adoring audience of junior executives office personnel.  He is JOSEPH TAKAGI, Sr V.P. of Sales Nakatomi, a multinational corporation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...I congratulate each and every one of you for making this one of the greatest days in the history of the Nakatomi corporation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., obviously still at work, an attractive BUSIN in her mid-thirties, studying a computer printout, heads her office.  Falling into step with her is HARRY ELLIS, thirty-seven, V.P. of Sales.  Well-dressed, with stylish, slicked-back hair, he looks and acts very smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, it's Christmas Eve.  Families... Stockings...chestnuts...Rudolph and Frosty...those things ring a bell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns into:

dialogues.speaker: HER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Her name is HOLLY GENNARO MCCLANE, though the nameplate o door stops after the first two.  She puts the printout do on her secretary's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in reply) I was thinking more of roaring fireplaces...mulled wine and a nice brie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly ignores the come-on, turns to her secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny, it's 6:40, you're making me feel like Ebeneezer Scrooge.  Go on, join the party, have some champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny slowly manipulates herself out of her seat.  She is enormously pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grateful) Thanks Ms. Gennaro. (worried) Do you think the baby can handle a little sip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing her) Ginny, that baby's ready to tend bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not giving up) How about tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly just points to the door.  He follows Ginny out, cle not giving up.  Just then the party on Holly's phone pick and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where a five-year old LUCY MCCLANE races her YOUNGER BROT to the phone, winsthe wrestling match, and answers with a of importance.  An Xmas tree is in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane residence.  Lucy McClane speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly suddenly smiles.  It is the first time we've seen h smile and it speaks volumes about the person hidden under tough business exterior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with affection) Hello, Lucy McClane.  This is your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and watches Ellis leave.  He "shoots" her wi "catch ya later" wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy!  When are you coming home?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.  You'll be in bed when I get there, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come say 'good night'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I always, you goose? (enjoying Lucy's giggle) Now put Paulina on the line, and no searching the house for presents!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught) I didn't look in the front closet under the steps!  Is Daddy coming home with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing this, jumping up and down) Yeah!  Daddy!  Daddy!  Daddy! (on second thought) And a Captain Power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little tightly) Well, we'll see what Santa and Mommy can do.  Goose, put Paulina on, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy hands the phone to a young Salvadorian woman, PAULIN the housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Holly.  You coming home soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. (beat) Did Mr. McClane call?                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly hides a trace of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...maybe there wasn't time before               *   the flight.  You should probably make up the spare room just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes, Mrs. Holly.  I do that already.                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly's smile comes through again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane, wearing his wool topcoat and carrying the bigges stuffed animal FAO Schwartz had in stock and his hangup b comes down the American Airlines ramp and into the termin He avoids one near-collision involving his stuffed animal act which drives him into another fender bender with a CU GIRL who looks like she's ready for high tide at Zuma.  A smiles, weaves onward, McClane looks at his own Arctic ge and then the girl as she kisses a similarly garbed boyfri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to himself) California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the terminal at:

dialogues.speaker: TERMINAL
dialogues.text: FAMILY REUNIONS are going on all around his as grandparen greet grown children and their children, YOUNG WIVES gree uniformed SOLDIERS, our Babbit businessman greets a pleas wife and two pleasant kids.  It's all very traditional, v touching and not the least bit corny.

dialogues.speaker: 7-B BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane watches, moved by the sight, then looks around th waiting area, just on the chance his family might be wait Instead he spots a thin, gangling black kid, ARGYLE, in a ill-fitting chauffeur's uniform.  As he waits he beats ou rhythmn on a "Nakatomi Corporation" card with J. McCLANE on it in magic marker.  McClane pauses in front of him, u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm John McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing himself) Argyle.  I'm your limo driver.  Hey, nice bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and starts walking.  McClane paces him, still ju bag and giant animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle.  Don't you take this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops) Do I?  I'm sorry.  You're gonna have to help me, man.  This is my first time driving a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  This is my first time riding in one.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE LIMO
dialogues.text: TILT UP from the Lincoln emblem on the car. Both Argyle and McClane are in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kick back and relax, man.  We got everything you need:  CD, CB, TV, VHS, telephone, full bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the back seat, which is occupied by the bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your friend is hot to trot...I know a couple of mama bears. (turning to McClane) ...Or is he married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane tries to get comfortable, scowls as a RUSTLING NO reveals wrappers and styrofoam from Taco Bell.  He scowls Argyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl was off today.  Hey, I didn't expect you to sit up front. (back to the topic) So, your lady live out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The past six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about that) Meanwhile, you still live in New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nosey, you know that, Argyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sorry.  When I was a cabdriver, see, people expected a little chit chat, a little eccentricity and comaraderie, I forgot how stuck up you limo guys were, so excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) It's okay, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instantly) So, you divorced of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a good job, it turned into a great career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But meant her moving here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer to Japan.  You're fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why didn't you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I'm a New York cop who used to be a New York kid, and I got six months backlog of New York scumbags I'm still trying to put behind bars. I don't just get up and move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the point) You mean you thought she wouldn't make it out here and she'd come crawling on back, so why bother to pack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane grins, he like Argyle even if he is direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, Argyle...you're fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (popping in a cassette) Mind if I play some tunes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hard RAP SONG blasts from the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some Christmas music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is Christmas music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And damned it if isn't, the Fat Boys of Run DMC doing a revisionist number on WHITE CHRISTMAS or something.  McCl gives up, looks out the window. 9       HIS P.O.V. Convertibles with Christmas trees in their back seats, Time/Temperature signs which reads:  69 degrees, palm tre trimmed in Christmas lights, intermittent West side token "Happy Chanukahs"...it is clear that Christmas L.A. style its own unique style.

dialogues.speaker: 11-A THE LIMO
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN FROM one of the stars of this film, the well-li impressive and spanking-new NAKATOMI BUILDING.  The limo up, parks, and Argyle gets out.  McClane lets himself out which is fine because Argyle doesn't remember he's suppos do it.  They both go to the rear of the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle climbs out of the limo and stops by the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you go on upstairs to the party, your lady sees you, you run into each other's arms.  Music comes up, you live happily ever after, that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's corny, but I could live with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it don't work out that way? Where you gonna stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the highrise lit by huge spotlights, then back at Argyle who's made no attempt to open the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what.  I'll pull into the parking garage and wait.  You score with your wife give me a call on the car phone and I'll leave your bags inside at the desk.  You strike out... I'll get you to a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands McClane a business card with the number on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the number) You're all right, Argyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember that when you sign for the tip. (pointing to the building) They're paying for it, so don't be shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane grins, heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful and -- on first glance -- deserted.  Finally a SOUND in the sterile lobby reveals the presence of a SECURITY GUARD hidden until now behind a massive desk. McClane goes there, signs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly McClane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard points to a prominent touch screen computer con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just type it in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane is confused for a moment, then he moves to the sc He gives the Guard a look...the Guard raises his eyebrows if to say give it a try.

dialogues.speaker: 13-A SCREEN
dialogues.text: McClane types, "McClane, Holly".  Pause.  The screen repl NO SUCH EMPLOYEE LISTED.

dialogues.speaker: 13-B MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Frowns...thinks.  Simultaneously inspired and suspicious, types again.

dialogues.speaker: 13-C THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: McClane types, GENNERO, HOLLY.  This time the screen CHAN shows an elevation of the building and then a floor plan 30th floor with Holly's office BLINKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  When you have to take a leak it'll help you find your zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirtieth floor...                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Take the express elevator and get off at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane nods, moves off.  He moves to the elevators, and does his experienced eye takes in:

dialogues.speaker: 13-E ANOTHER SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Patrolling a different area.

dialogues.speaker: 13-F SEVERAL HI-TECH CAMERAS AND SENSORS
dialogues.text: which are cleverly worked into the decor of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: 13-G BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane reacts with bored professionalism, NODS to the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of hardware...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard shrugs.  McClane gets in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane hits "30" and REACTS to the hyper-powered SPEED w which he rises.  He rotates his head, getting out the tra cricks. As he approaches the 30th floor we hear a tremendous THUM THROBBING NOISE.  McClane stops and listens before he realizes -- it's the party.  As the doors open the noise ATTACKS us.

dialogues.speaker: 30TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane moves around the edge of the party, gradually spiraling inward.  He grabs a glass of Mimosa champagne p from a passing tray, sips...scowls.  Spotting open beers an ice bucket, he tosses the punch into a potted plant, e burying the plastic glass.  Sipping the beer, he moves th the dense party.  People he doesn't know throw streamers him. A WOMAN kisses him.  He grins.  A MAN kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, shaking his head) California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he queries a DANCING WOMAN.  The MUSIC drowns out words but she nods, points off in some generic direction. McClane heads that way, cuts around a Christmas tree, los his bearings.  He sees:

dialogues.speaker: 15-A TAKAGI
dialogues.text: who has an air of authority.  McClane goes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly Gennero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent half my life on airplanes,               * I can recognize someone who just got off one. (shaking hands) I'm Joe Takagi, Mr. McClane.  I have ...something to do with this company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi smiles, leads the way.  As they approach Holly's o door, McClane notices the name there is -- again -- "Genn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly went to the Vault room to FAX some documents...she should be back any...

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Ellis is behind the desk.  He's SNIFFLING and just as the come in he SWEEPS the back of the slick desktop with his Both McClane and Takagi catch on...but Takagi tries to hi his awareness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...hi...I just had to make a quick call, and this was the nearest phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Ellis rises) Ellis, this is John McClane... (with meaning) Holly's policeman? (to McClane) Ellis is in charge of International Acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands with Ellis) That explains the recent deal with Bolivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis REACTS, runs a checking finger under his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Relax, Ellis.  I'm off duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager to change the subject, to McClane) Can I get you anything?  Food?  Cake? Watered down champagne punch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I'm fine. (looking through the glass) You throw quite a party.  I didn't know they had Christmas in Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we're flexible.  Pearl Harbor didn't work out, we got you with tape decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane laughs.  He likes this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's kind of a double celebration.        * We closed a pretty big deal today and a lot of it was due to Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door OPENS.  Holly comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set, Joe.  The contracts went over the wire, and -- (surprised) John...!

dialogues.speaker: 16-A MCCLANE AND HOLLY
dialogues.text: A moment.  Does the sound of the party stop for him?  We it.  For her?  It's more cryptic.  We sure hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) I was hoping you made that flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I was hoping you were hoping that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, kisses him on the cheek.  Ellis notes the awk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McClane) You wife's made for this business. She know how to drive a hard bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I remember our first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show him the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hesitates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, show him.  What're you, embarrassed? (to McClane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little token of our appreciation for all her work. He takes Holly's wrist, holds it up.  McClane smoothly ta the wrist away from Ellis, looks at the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, but one of us is three hours out of sync.  I think it's me. (to Holly, pointedly) Is there a place I can wash up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy for the excuse) Sure.  Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go out.  Alone, Takagi's look at Ellis shows his disapproval of certain snow at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Emory freight truck turns off Olympic into the undergr parking garage of Nakatomi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes down the ramp and passes Argyle's black limo.  Th driver's seat is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle sits in the back seat hidden from the outside worl the tinted rear windows.  He is making a drink from the b with the TV on and his rap music blasting from the casset player, oblivious to the truck passing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emory truck stops in front of the service elevator on next level down.  As the truck idles, the uniformed drive makes a note on his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP FROM McClane's BARE FEET.  He is clenching and unclenching his toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, actually feeling tension decline) Son-of-a-bitch.  It works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits on the desk here, watches him remove his jacke shirt, etc.  Begin to wash up in the private bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.  You know, I think that Ellis has his eye on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay... (pause) ... I have an eye on his private bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane's face shows his relief (or rather, his attempt n to show any).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where are you staying?  This                    * all happened so fast I didn't even ask you on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane finishes drying his face and steps to the bath do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Cappy Roberts retired out here a couple years ago.  He said I could bunk with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...Where does he live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona...no, Pomona, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pomona!  You'll be in the car the whole time...Look, let's make this easy.  I have a spare bedroom.  It's not huge, but the kids would love to have you at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane fixes her with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; honest) I would too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lock eyes for a moment, but it's an intense moment t says a lot about how they still feel about each other. Just then a man and a woman, both a little tipsy, open th door to the office, see that it's occupied and beat a has retreat.  The interruption temporarily dents the mood.  H tries to smile.  But for McClane it's the last frustratio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've missed you.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially my name.  You must miss it every time you write a check.  When did you start calling yourself 'Ms. Gennero'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught) This is a Japanese company, you know? They figure a married woman, she's on the way out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  It's unnerving.  I remember this one particular married woman, she went out the door so fast there was practically a jetwash...I mean, talk about your wind chill factor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't we have this same conversation in July?  Damn it, John, there was an opportunity out here -- I had to take it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what it did to our marriage -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job and my title and my salary did nothing to our marriage except change your idea of what it should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here it comes.  One of those 'meaningful relationship conversations.' I never should've let you get those magazine subscriptions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know my idea of a marriage? It's a partnership where people help each other over the rough spots -- console each other when there's a down...and when there's an up, well, hell, a little Goddamn applause or an attaboy wouldn't be too bad. (quietly) I needed that, John. (pause) I deserved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a clumsy pause as if she's almost challenging him say...something but he sets his jaw, says nothing.  Just the door opens and Ginny leans inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Gennero?  Mr. Takagi is looking for you...he wants you to say something to the troops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ginny.  I'll be a second. Oh, this is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock bright 'radio' voice) Hi.  John Gennero here.  I'm the sensitive and supportive man of the eighties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny looks puzzled, goes out.  Holly sighs, moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a few minutes.  Wait here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I always?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.  Immediately, he slaps his forehead, contrite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Schmuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard at the front desk notices the Emory truck on hi monitor.  The Guard continues to watch the Emory truck an only half notices as a Mercedes pulls up in front of the building and two extremely well-dressed BUSINESSMAN (late twenties) climb out and start up the stairs for the door. they cross the lobby to the Guard's table to sign in, we their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (animatedly) ...So, Kareem rebounds -- listen, this is a great play -- feeds Worthy on the break, over to A.C., to Magic, back to Worthy in the lane and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the other man pulls out a Walther pistol with a silencer and aims it at the Guard's forehead.  Before the Guard can react he pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Boom...two points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The speed with which the murder takes place sets the ton for the rest of the action.)  The killer moves behind the desk, stepping over a small pool of blood from the Guard. His name is KYLE, big, with long blond hair like a rock drummer.  Karl takes off the silencer and looks at the vi monitor of the Emory truck.  The first man, Theo, opens h briefcase, takes out a portable CB radio and speaks into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: the driver nods at the security camera as several men cli the rear of the van and begin unloading wooden crates by service elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane looks at all the lavishness around him and picks phone by the toilet.  He opens his wallet and takes out t phone number Argyle have him.  A photo of his children st him. It's of Holly, the two children and himself in happier da Six months ago, before Nakatomi came calling to Holly's d McClane flips it over.  On the back in crude but painstak hand of a five-year-old it says:  WE MISS YOU, DADDY.  LO LUCY (and in more primitive letters) JOHN. McClane returns the photo to his wallet, dials the number

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo enters the small control room and comfortably sits b a maintenance keyboard.  Whistling a vaguely familiar tun TYPES in some commands and locks down the passenger eleva up to the 30th floor.  Then with several more computer co systematically causes:

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Theo finishes typing and disconnects the keyboard and pul the wires from beneath the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to a service elevator open TO REVEAL HANS GRUBE impeccably dressed, lean and handsome, he steps out into lobby like he owns the building -- and in a way he does. Theo steps to the door of the control room and tosses Han COMPUTER CARD. Hans goes to the front door, waves the card over a magnet plate.  An LED BLINKS and the door LOCKS with a THUD. Hans looks out at the street.  Appropriately enough, "not creature is stirring."  Century City is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: 35-A LOBBY
dialogues.text: An elevator opens REVEALING TEN MORE MEN, all armed with Kalashnikov machine guns are carrying canvas kit bags.  O of them, EDDIE, a rugged American in his twenties, goes t the dead guard and immediately begins changing into his c Meanwhile: A)  Karl takes a tool case from the elevator and joins hi brother TONY, first playfully grabbing him.  They head for the basement stairwell; B)  Theo leaves the control room and nods to Hans. C)  Eddie finished adjusting buttons and snaps on his pilfered uniform, takes his position behind the front des

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: looks at his watch and seems pleased.  He steps into the elevator with the others and presses the button for the 3 floor.  The entire sequence has taken maybe sixty seconds 37      INT. ELLIS' BATHROOM - 30th FLOOR - SAME McClane is still barefoot, his pant legs now rolled up ab his ankles.  He stretches his toes again.  Damn, it works lights up a new Marlboro, dials a number on the (bathroom phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large sign says:  PACIFIC BELL EMPLOYEES ONLY.  Inside stands in front of an intimidating matrix of phone lines what he has in mind won't require a doctorate in Electric Engineering.  Karl comes over, gives his an elder brother punch on the arm, points out what to do.  Together they f on four CPV plastic conduits which run out of the main pa over their heads.  Tony nods.  Opens a case REVEALING a compact electric chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle is reclining on the seat.  The music is on so loud it is nearly impossible to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, John, what's the word on you and your lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vote's not in yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl cuts through the four tubes one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Vote's not in yet?'  What's that supposed to mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, 'All My Children'? We're making progress.  After I get my foot out of my mouth, we'll really be cooking, and then I can -- He stops and gently taps the phone cradle.  No dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle looks at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...Mr. Mac, you there? He turns down the music but there is on one on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, call me back, John.  You got the number. He hangs up and turns the volume back up.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS' OFFICE
dialogues.text: McClane hangs up the original phone and then tries the ot one on the desk.  It, too, is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans and the others approaching the 30th floor.  As they closer, we hear the noise of the speakers growing louder louder.  The men cock their weapons and brace themselves car stops and the elevator doors open.  ON THE SOUND OF G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane grabs his shoulder harness off the back of the ch moves quickly to the doorway.  He looks down the hall. 47      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. Two terrorists, FRANCE and FRITZ, armed with M-5 machine searching the offices on the hall one by one.  They open look in from the hallway, and move on quickly to the next They are four offices away and moving fast. McClane looks across the corridor and sees the stairwell -- too far to reach without being seen.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: steps back, throws off the safety on his Beretta and brac himself.  He opens the door, peers through a crack at:

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS as McClane's eyes SCAN their weapons...he's to outgunned, and he knows it. Franco and Fritz reach the office just before Ellis' and open the door REVEALING the man and woman who interrupted and McClane a few minutes before, now in the throes of passionate lovemaking on the desk.  The two terrorists sm at each other, then enter the office. A moment later the man, (trying desperately to pull up hi pants) and the woman (buttoning her blouse) are pushed ou into the hall and toward the larger group by Fritz.  The terrorist, Franco, goes to Ellis' office and opens the do It is...empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON McClane's bare feet padding quickly up the concr stairs, two at a time.  We FOLLOW him up, then out onto t 50-A    31th FLOOR This is the mezzanine floor immediately above the main Nakatomi lobby.  McClane sees Theo and KRISTOFF wheeling of equipment.  McClane ducks back into the stairwell, he up another flight and out onto:

dialogues.speaker: UNFINISHED FLOOR
dialogues.text: Eventually it will be one large secretarial pool, but onl portion is completed.  Half-finished partitions and offic furniture in its original plastic wrappings are everywher One end has a few lonely finished working areas. McClane moves quickly to a desk and picks up a phone.  It out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window at: 51-A    NEIGHBORING BUILDING - MCCLANE'S P.O.V. A high-rise apartment building a half-block away sparkles lights.  McClane stares at a PRETTY GIRL in her bedroom. wearing drop dead underwear right out of the Victoria's S catalog.  As we watch, she flops down on her bed, and wit one long leg in the air, effortlessly dials a call on her high-tech phone.  It seems so easy.

dialogues.speaker: 51-B BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Frustrated, he watches this, knits his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52      INT. 30th FLOOR (HOSTAGE FLOOR) - SAME The employees have been herded to the center of the room the desks have been pulled back.  Many people are whimper

dialogues.speaker: 52-A HOLLY
dialogues.text: She looks around the room for McClane.  She's so intent o this that she doesn't see one TERRORIST waving her forwar Exasperated, he SHOVES her.  Her glare at him shows us he mettle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the employees are bunched together, Ellis seeks out Ho He's clearly scared but trying to fake courage.  He pats hand "reassuringly." Hans steps up on top of a desk and looks over the group. reaches into a pocket...several people CRINGE...but what comes out with is a Bottega Venata pocket notebook.  He c his own scribblings like a dais speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing, in control) Ladies and gentlemen, due to the Nakatomi Corporation's legacy of greed around the globe, it is about to be taught a lesson on real power. You...will be witnesses. If our demands are not met, however -- (sad smile) -- You may become participants instead. (beat, checking notes) Now, where is...'Takagi'?  Where is the man who... (slight smile) ...used to be in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi is shoved forward.  He's worried but far from cowe Hans steps towards him.  Extends a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quite civil) Mr. Takagi.  How do you do.  My name is Hans Gruber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi is confused by his charm.  Hans waves politely in direction of an elevator and with an armed escort takes t executive away.  CAMERA ADJUSTS to show Holly, concerned. 56      INT. STAIRWELL - 33rd FLOOR - SAME McClane pauses outside the stairwell door to the 33rd flo he presses the handle and cracks the door open TO REVEAL computer floor.  The computer machinery drones on under t lights behind plate glass windows.  McClane quietly close the door and moves to another floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself) 32 construction...33 computers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans, Takagi, Karl and Tony.  Riding silently.  Hans alon seems relaxed.  He whistles.  We recognize it as a snatch Wagner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice suit.  John Philips...London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi stares at him, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I have two myself. (beat, as he exits:) I'm told Arafat shops there too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane starts to open the stairwell door to the Machine when a NOISE above him gets his attention.  He moves sile up one flight to the roof.  Quietly, he cracks the door a looks out onto a Machine Floor on the lower level of the 61      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. Three terrorist, JAMES, ULI and HEINRICH, are unpacking t wooden crates we saw in the garage from the service eleva It's not clear what they're doing but it seems very milit like and ominously defensive.  Heinrich POINTS up to the ceiling and says something in German.  The others nod.  H starts to turn towards the CAMERA and:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: closes the door and slips back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands enters, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when Alexander saw the breadth of his domain, he wept.  For there were no more worlds to conquer. (to Takagi) The benefits of a classical education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans admired a scale model of a bridge.  Behind him are photographs of the gorge where the bridge will be constru Karl and Tony listen.  Takagi watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.  I always enjoyed models as a boy.  The exactness, the attention to every foreseeable detail... perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) This is what this is about?  Out building project in Indonesia? Contrary to what you people think, we're going to develop that region... not 'exploit' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans straightens, looks hard at Takagi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. (smiling) I read the article in Forbes.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi looks confused.  Hans puts a friendly arm around T shoulders and guides him into the adjacent board room whe Theo types in commands onto a built-in computer console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Takagi, we could discuss industrialization of men's fashions all day, but I'm afraid my associate, Mr. Theo, has some questions for you. Sort of fill-in-the blanks questions actually...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: sits fingers poised over the keyboard.  Hans sits opposit Takagi stands like the accused at the foot of the table, just read the screen, blurts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have that code...! (beat; to Hans) You broke in here to access out computer?!?  Any information you could get -- they wake up in Tokyo in the morning, they'll change it! You won't be able to blackmail our executives or threaten --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans barks him to silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIT DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takagi complies.  Hans is abruptly compassionate and quie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Takagi...I'm not interested in your computer. (beat) I'm interested in the 640 million dollars in negotiable bearer bonds you have in you vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Takagi's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...I know about them.  The code key is a necessary step in accessing the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want...money?  What kind of terrorists are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Who said we were terrorists?

dialogues.speaker: 65-A MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He tiptoes along, gun held ready.  He can HEAR the MUMBLE voices from the conference room, moves slowly towards it.

dialogues.speaker: 65-B CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Hans slowly takes out his Walther and his silencer.  He f his silencer a moment, as if making a decision, then slip back into his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weighing the gun) The code key, please...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's useless to you!  There's seven safeguards on our vault, and the code key is only one of them!  You'll never get it open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans lifts the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's no reason not to tell it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Karl) I told you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans gives them both a look like an annoyed schoolmaster, turns back to Takagi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too nice a suit to ruin, Mr. Takagi.  I'm going to count to three.  There will not be a four.  Give me the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks the gun:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know it!  get on a Goddamn jet to Tokyo and ask the chairman! I'm telling you!  You're just going to have to kill me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!!  He pulls the trigger:

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE MUSEUM
dialogues.text: reacts as if shot. A66-A   HIS P.O.V. The glass doors to the boardroom are splattered red and dripping...

dialogues.speaker: 66-A INSIDE
dialogues.text: Takagi is still seated, but the chair in flat on its back blood flowing out into the carpet. Hans springs to his feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do it the hard way!  Tony, see if you can dispose of that. (the body) Karl, you'd better check Heinrich's work up on the machine floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl, in the midst of handing Theo a fifty dollar bill, n

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: stunned, sees Hans move and tries to retreat.  But his gu bumps the underside of the table:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: hears it.  Karl is the first to move:

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: springs through the door, finds nothing.  He checks two adjoining rooms, the first is deserted.  The second...is locked.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: returns to Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) See to Heinrich... (to Theo) Now...you can break the code key...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) You didn't bring me along for my charming personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he heads for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) 'Though you could have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans smiles, confident in his team, and follows.  CAMERA SETTLES ON the door that Karl found locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly lets out a breath, praying softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle.  Tell me you heard the shot. Tell me you heard the shot and you're calling the police right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle is on the car phone.  The music is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working, honey.  Working hard. 'Course I'll be by later to pick you up, have I ever lies to you?  My boss? He thinks I'm cruising to Palm Springs...

dialogues.speaker: 72-A MACHINE LEVEL
dialogues.text: Heinrich PRESSES something into a niche here, scrambles l a monkey to a new position.  Helped by one of his men, he JUMPS down, moves to another area, climbs up again, remov something from his shoulder bag.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Hans and Theo enter the safe room.  The huge corporate sa looms in front of them.  Theo places three kit bags onto table and rolls up his sleeves.  He swivels a computer co into handy reach, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty minutes to break the code... Two hours for the five mechanicals. The seventh lock...that's out of my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If out plan works...the FBI will get rid of it for us. Theo grins, begins typing.

dialogues.speaker: 73-A HIS SCREEN
dialogues.text: He types BEGIN ALGORITHM CODE PROGRAM.  RANDOM NUMBERS AN LETTERS begin going by:  AAAAA; 11111; AAAAB; 11112.

dialogues.speaker: 32ND FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane moves out onto the 31st floor, angry at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck didn't you stop him? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, you ignorant sonofabitch, you'd be dead, too.  Think...think, Goddamnit! Suddenly he looks up at the ceiling and sees a sprinkler His look drops to the wall and focuses on a small red fir switch by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM sounds.  Quickly firemen move to their machines voice of a 911 DISPATCHER drones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main Wilshire units.  Two alarm fire at Nakatomi Plaza -- The voice continues as the station doors open and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire alarm indicator light showing which floor has soun fire alarm -- suddenly begins flashing, emitting short, l beeps.  Eddie, the terrorist in the guard's uniform and m the station, immediately picks up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: 32ND FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane stands at windows looking Northward for fire truc Suddenly we SEE the flashing red lights of FOUR ENGINES i traffic two miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, baby...come to Papa.  I'm gonna kiss your Goddamn dalmatian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rides the elevator back to the 30th floor with Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, to Eddie on CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911, give them the name and badge number on your uniform and cancel the alarm...then disable the system. (looks across at Tony, presses talk button again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?  What floor did the alarm go off?

dialogues.speaker: 78-A MACHINE FLOOR
dialogues.text: They've heard the alarm here, too.  Heinrich, Marco and Uli HEAR the alarm and continue their mysterious work.

dialogues.speaker: UNFINISHED FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane stands silhouetted against the window.  In the di he can see another fire truck swing off Santa Monica onto Avenue of the Stars. Suddenly the red light on the first truck goes out, then second.  McClane watches in disbelief.  The trucks slow a turn down separate side streets, heading for home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch... Just then the elevator bell rings and we HEAR the ELEVATO OPEN.  A figure (Tony) slips into the shadows -- his mach gun drawn.  We MOVE WITH HIM FROM the elevator area until reaches the light switch and throws it illuminating the e floor.  McClane is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ON MCCLANE
dialogues.text: under a desk.  He takes in his options. 81      HIS P.O.V. The feet of Tony.  They move slowly in his direction.  Mc Looks down the aisle next to the windows.  It leads to a of cubicles at the other end of the floor and is a clear if he can make it past Tony.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: He moves steadily toward the area where we saw McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire has been called off, my friend.  No one is coming to help you.  You might as well come out and join the others. (fingers the trigger of his machine gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise not to hurt you. Moving more confidently, he steps up to McClane's desk, t around it and fires a blast into the space.  It is empty. the SOUND OF THE MACHINE GUN FADES he listens and hears a SOUND -- a NOISE coming from the other end of the room ne the cubicles. Tony heads toward the noise.  Sensing a trap, he moves pa each cubicle carefully, checking each office until he rea the doorway of the last one.  The sound is just around th partition.  He tenses, then spins into the cubicle. 83      TONY'S P.O.V. A radial arm saw spins noisily.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: grins at his nervousness.  He moves to turn it off, not realizing the sound has buried the soft rustle of McClane steps INTO FRAME behind him, McClane shoves his pistol ba against Tony's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, Police...don't move or name your beneficiary. Tony doesn't.  McClane cocks his Beretta.  Tony watches h calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you are a policeman.  There are rules for policemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  My Captain keeps telling me the same thing. McClane suddenly PISTOL WHIPS Tony across the head.  Tony REELS, then swallows, worried for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Suddenly Tony spins to the side and McClane FIRES, but th big man's momentum slams McClane into a filing cabinet an his pistol into the hall. Tony fires his machine gun, but McClane kicks him into th He locks his arms around the big man's neck in a hold tha sends Tony reeling into the hall.  McClane holds on as th slam through several plastic board partitions.  They care across the hall into the stairwell door, opening it, and into:

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL LANDING
dialogues.text: then down the concrete steps into the wall on the landing For a moment, both men lie still.  McClane, still holding Tony's neck, releases it and the man's head flops sickeni to the side. For a moment McClane just looks at the dead man.  Then, s methodically, he begins to SEARCH HIM.  He turns all his inside out, looks at his clothing labels, stares long and hard at a California driver's license with Tony's picture it.  He expertly examines the machine gun when a HISSING coming from somewhere attracts his attention. He rises, moves cautiously to the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tony's CB, which has fallen from the dead man's wais the struggle.  McClane stares at it, formulating a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN FROM Tony's now shoeless feet TO McClane, who sits on floor near the body hurriedly lacing up the dead terroris boots on his own feet.  He ties the last lace and tries t a couple of steps. He winces in pain, goes off balance.  Quickly he starts t the boots off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million terrorists in the world and I kill the one with feet smaller than my sister. He yanks off the boots and tosses them into the garbage. he pulls the body up and sets it down on a secretary's ch He starts to push it along when he gets an idea and moves

dialogues.speaker: 86-A A DESK
dialogues.text: Where he scribbles a note we cannot read on a piece of pa Then his eyes fall on some Xmas decorations nearby.  He s to himself.

dialogues.speaker: 86-B IN THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON McClane's back as he pushes Tony's body on swive chair into the elevator.  (NOTE:  WE CANNOT SEE TONY'S HE CAMERA ADJUSTS as McClane pushes the buttons for the 31th 30th floors. We notice he's got the dead man's machine gun and that a desk ruler protrudes from McClane's back pocket. The elevator doors close and the car starts down.  After dropped only half a floor, McClane forces the doors open his fingers -- stopping the car between floors. Using the ruler he blocks open the inside doors, then ope outside doors of the floor above (31st) with his fingers pulls himself up onto the carpeted floor, then up onto th of the car.  Once on the roof of the car he reaches over edge and removes the ruler, closing the inside doors and the car in motion again.

dialogues.speaker: 86-C HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: The hostages have been gathered together in a group in th of the open floor, guards flanking them.  The elevators a barely visible from the edge of the group, which is where and Holly are sitting.  Ginny winces, uncomfortable on th Holly soothes her.  Hans stands in front of them like a s camp counselor in front of the assembled bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted this to be professional, efficient, adult, cooperative.  Not a lot to ask.  Alas, your Mr. Takagi did not see it that way... (harder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he won't be joining us for the rest of his life. (as that sinks in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are prepared to go any way you make us.  When we have achieved our aims you can walk out of here... or be carried out.  Decide now, each of you.  But remember that we have planned everything to the last detail. We are completely in change. A "DING" attracts his attention.  He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors OPEN and Fritz, guarding the area.  WH gun held ready.  His jaw drop as he sees: 87-A    TONY'S BODY - HIS P.O.V. Still and dead, flopped in a swivel chair, a red Santa ha gaily placed on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the hostages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them over there.  Schnell! The guards quickly hustle the hostages away as Hans cross the elevator, but for before.

dialogues.speaker: 87-C HOLLY
dialogues.text: Sees the body...and REACTS.  She knows her husband's abil not to mention his twisted sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: 87-D NEAR THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: As Fritz stands there, confused, Hans comes to the elevat Franco, lifts Tony's chin and sees that his neck has been snapped.  He sees a folded piece of paper in Tony's colla takes it out.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTE
dialogues.text: It reads, "Now I have a machine gun.  HO-HO-HO."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps a security guard we overlooked...? Hans lifts Tony's chin again, lets the head flop over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security guard?  They're usually tired and burned out old policemen growing           *   fat on a pension...This is... something else.

dialogues.speaker: 87-G ROOF OF ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: McClane is staring through a tiny crack at the scene belo CAMERA ADJUSTS from Fritz in the b.g. to Hans and France below. McClane is WRITING in his weather-beaten cop's notebook. first notation is NUMBER OF HOSTAGES:  HOLLY + 30 -- odd. it says, NUMBER OF TERRORISTS?  As we watch, he adds "3 ? 87-H    in Lobby (?) and 2+ with hostages??  Plus ones on roof (3)."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly spooked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something, Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...we have to tell Karl his brother is dead.  Tell him to come down. Now McClane writes "HANS=LEADER.  Karl=BROTHER.  USE THIS As Fritz calls Karl on his CB, Hans looks at Franco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franco, you and Fritz take the body upstairs and out of sight.  I don't want the hostages to think too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of the car, listening to the conversation below. and Fritz step into the car and the doors on the elevator The car accelerates upward and McClane grabs onto the hea grease-coated cables to keep his balance.  Already his cl are soiled; his face and feet, arms and hair are dark fro dirt and sweat.  The car speeds up the shaft -- passing t bringing Karl down to the hostage floor -- and stops at t machine floor.  The doors open and McClane hears them rol chair with the body off the car.  McClane looks up. 89      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. A metal catwalk runs around the inside of the elevator sh

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: pulls himself up onto it.  As he moves along the catwalk for a way out, he passes an unmarked metal door, 2'x3'. pushes it open and looks in. 91      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. Total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: takes out a coin.  A quarter.  He stops, switches to a ni Throws it into the void.  It is a full four seconds until HEAR it "CHING" and bounce on concrete far below.  You do have to be a mathematics whiz to know it's a long drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... He moves cautiously around a corner and we SEE a metal la leading up to a door marked PUMP ROOM.  Opening the door McClane enters a darkened:

dialogues.speaker: PUMP ROOM
dialogues.text: damp and full of pipes and goes to another door.  He crac door and looks out. 94      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. The lower level of the roof.  Open and deserted.  Only a above him is higher.

dialogues.speaker: 30TH FLOOR, (HOSTAGE FLOOR)
dialogues.text: WIDEN as a FILING CABINET is FLUNG across the floor, draw SLAMMING out, papers flying.  KARL has done this, and he' barely started.  He FLINGS a LAMP against a wall, PUNCHES into the plaster.  Finally, Hans goes to him, lays contro hands on the man's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are feeling.  But this is not productive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my only brother...my only family! (a flat statement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want blood for my blood.  We search...now. He starts to move.  Hans stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Heinrich's team must finish planting the detonators...and Theo needs time on the vault.  After the                  * police come they'll waste hours trying to negotiate...that's when we search                 * for this man.  Until then...we do not alter the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he alters it...?                              * For once Hands doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: 95-A HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: They've heard the alarm, can see and sense the agitation their captors.  Ellis slides over to Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look happy...something's gone wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?  Christ, he could fuck this whole thing up...what does he think he's doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about his job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His 'job' is 3000 miles away.  Without him, they might let us go...at least we have a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to Mr. Takagi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane climbs to the heliport and leans against the leew of a wall surrounding it.  Shielded from wind, he pulls o CB, turns to channel nine, and starts broadcasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday, Mayday!  Anyone!  Terrorists have seized and Nakatomi building and are holding 30 or more hostages! I say again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans, Karl, Fritz and France hear the clear signal over H CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- unknown number of terrorists, six or more, armed with automatic weapons at Nakatomi, Century City... Somebody answer me, Goddamnit! Karl looks almost...satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof.  It's the best place to transmit. They move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUPERVISOR weaves her way back from the break room towa DISPATCHER who is monitoring the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same address as that fire signal --                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the false alarm?  I'll handle                     * it. She plugs in her headset.  (Her condescending, arrogant t like the one in the famous tape where the dispatch lady s so much time on red tape that the patient dies.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, whoever you are.  This channel is reserved for emergency calls only --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking shit, lady!  Do I sound like I'm ordering a pizza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Franco and Fritz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one kills him but me. It's an order and the look he gives the other two backs i Karl checks his magazine, SLAPS it into his rifle as the opens to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane moves around the roof, circling the helipad, maki he has a good enough view to avoid being ambushed.  He ca see in all directions at once but he's doing the best he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've already killed one hostage, and they're fortifying their positions while we're bullshitting!  Now, send police backup ASAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I've already told you, this is a reserved channel.  If this is an emergency call, dial 911 on your telephone.  Otherwise I will report you to the police --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fine!  Report me!  Hey, come down here and fucking arrest me!  Send the police.  NOW -- ! Suddenly machine gun shells rip into the concrete wall in of him.  The noise is deadening as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Supervisor and Dispatcher reach for their headsets i pain from the INTENSE SOUND and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running.  Tracer bullets rip into the wall behind him.  H reaches the corner and sees the other two terrorists movi toward him.  Before they see him, he leaps down to the ne level out of range of Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dispatcher looks critically at the Supervisor in the sudden silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (importantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ad...have a black-and-white do a drive-by.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 7-11
dialogues.text: TIGHT as one after another after another HOSTESS TWINKIE stacked up on the counter.  CAMERA WIDENS and we SEE the young male CLERK, who stifles a smile.  Another teenage employee behind the counter also smothers a laugh. The customer is POWELL, young for a police veteran, old f the rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you guys just ate donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're for my wife.  She's pregnant. If I knew she was gonna eat a dozen at a shot, I woulda bought stock in the company. The Clerk nods and puts them in a bag.  As Powell pays, s his BELT RADIO crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch to One Adam Ten, over. Powell grabs the radio, speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Adam Ten, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investigate a code two at Nakatomi Plaza, Century City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakatomi Plaza? He moves to the door, steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell looks towards the horizon and up. There it is, Nakatomi, in all its gleaming glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Adam Ten, do you copy? Powell is already moving to the car.  He tosses in the tw hops behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into police radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, dispatch.  I'm on the way. And he BURNS RUBBER leaving the store:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running for his life, from Fritz and Franco, doesn't real he is being herded around the building toward Karl.  Sudd McClane turns a corner and sees Karl.  The big man fires burst and McClane ducks back stopping at the exterior doo to the pump room he used before.  It is locked from the i He BLOWS the lock off with a burst from his machine gun a slips into the darkness of the:

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT NEAR PUMP ROOM
dialogues.text: Coming quickly out of the pump room, McClane picks his wa over the same ground as a few minutes before and opens th to the elevator shaft.  The dimly lit shaft yawns before He starts down the ladder back to the catwalk, moves alon it -- STOPS. The catwalk ends, and the elevator is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl crosses, starts to open the door to the elevator sha when suddenly their radio crackles with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl?  Franco?  Did you catch him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he's in the elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prefect.  The elevators are locked off.              *   He can't escape.  Just shut him in and return to base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans, he killed by brother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl, I know you want him, but the police are probably on their way. Maybe we can convince them it was all a mistake, but not if they hear gunshots! If you lock him in he'll be neutralized -- now do it!  Karl?  Karl! Karl turns off his radio.  In the light of their flashlig the two other terrorists look at Karl in stunned disbelie He opens the door to the elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's OVERHEARD enough of this to realize he's in deep shi He backtracks to the air shaft door, strikes a cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: 117-A ELEVATOR SHAFT, (OPPOSITE SIDE)
dialogues.text: Karl steps off the ladder to the catwalk, his own gun hel ready.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: HEARING Karl's approach, McClane thinks fast, looks down his narrow confines, and then at:

dialogues.speaker: 118-A HIS WEAPON
dialogues.text: and its canvas gunsling and metal strap slides.

dialogues.speaker: 118-B BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Quickly, McClane lets out all the slack in the sling.  Th he BRACES the weapon across the outside opening of the ai shaft door and lowers himself into the:

dialogues.speaker: AIR SHAFT
dialogues.text: meanwhile holding onto the canvas sling with his elbows b over it like a kid doing a half-asses skin-the-cat on a s set. His feet slowly move down the smooth aluminum walls until reach the top of the air duct, then DANGLE in the open sp He straightens his arms to give him length enough to touc the bottom edge of the duct. Suddenly he FEELS something GIVE above him and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE SLING
dialogues.text: It was designed to carry a gun on a man, not vice versa. few inches of extra canvas are sliding through the clips. When they're gone...he will be too.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: He moves silently toward the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE'S TOES
dialogues.text: now only inches from the bottom edge.  McClane's arms are fully extended now.  He hears Karl on the metal catwalk. muscles strain and quiver.

dialogues.speaker: THE SLING
dialogues.text: One of the canvas end slips through the clip.

dialogues.speaker: ON MCCLANE
dialogues.text: FALLING.  He grabs the ledge of the air duct as he falls his body slams into the aluminum wall with an echoing BOO Above him on the catwalk the rifle rattles on the metal o the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON KARL
dialogues.text: Around the corner Karl FREEZES, unsure of the sound:

dialogues.speaker: ON MCCLANE
dialogues.text: holding onto the ledge by his hands.  With every ounce of strength he tries to pull himself up into the horizontal clawing for a hold.

dialogues.speaker: ON KARL
dialogues.text: He rounds the corner and sees McClane's rifle lying benea the doorway.  He moves to the small door, shines his ligh aims his rifle down into the air shaft ready to fire. 128     HIS P.O.V. The shaft is deserted.  Moving his light around he sees t duct.  Without hesitation he turns and backtracks to the room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies exhausted and motionless in the narrow crawl spac awkwardly fishes out the lighter from his shirt pocket an thumbs it ON. The flickering GLOW shows him this ain't no place for claustrophobics -- it's a long, long long dark and narrow corridor full of weird shadows.  The far end (if there ev if one?) is BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew...for a moment there I was worried. He turns out his lighter, and starts crawling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three terrorists rush down from the roof in hot pursu Karl leading the way through the door.  Karl points quick the left and right where there are a series of rooms.  Th others checks these while Karl approaches the CAMERA, tri finger ITCHING.  Almost immediately, the others return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Karl looks puzzled.  Then he thinks, mentally retracing M few options.  Karl's eyes scan the architecture here, and suddenly he looks UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling is criss-crossed with air ducts.  He fires a burst into the ducts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane remains motionless in the air duct.  Three quarte holes inches from his face show how close Karl came to na him.  Sweat covers his face, drips silently onto the alum

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE ROOM
dialogues.text: Karl listens patiently for sound.  Just then the two othe terrorists return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Karl hesitates a moment, fighting his instincts before fi turning to go.  Suddenly the duct McClane is in GROANS sl under his weight.  Karl stops and looks up at the matrix aluminum duct work, trying to single out the source of th sound.  He steps back into the room and raises his rifle. Holding it upright he presses the barrel up into the bell of McClane's air duct, feeling for weight -- the weight o body.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE AIR DUCT
dialogues.text: McClane sees the indention of the barrel pressing into th aluminum fifteen feet away.  There is a pause and another three feet closer.  He can hear Karl's footsteps on the concrete -- moving slowly below the duct.

dialogues.speaker: ON KARL
dialogues.text: His eyes are fixed above him on the air duct.  He presses barrel up again.  Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ON MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Silently he moves his hand, slowly draws his Beretta.  Th next indention presses up six feet away.  McClane points gun downward and waits.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: stops directly below him.  The barrel starts up and just touches the duct under McClane when Franco returns to the door and calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl!  Police!  Come on. Karl hesitates then lowers his gun and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He hears the door close and lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large LED WINDOW in the front of the safe BEEPS and l creep by:  ACCESS CODE ACCEPTED.  We HEAR a CLUNK. CAMERA ADJUSTS to show Theo, who grins.  Now his computer screen reads, LOCK #1 DISABLED.  DO YOU WISH TO PROCEED? Theo puts goggles on his eyes, holds out his hands toward Kristoff like a doctor requesting a scalpel.  Kristoff gi him a GIANT DRILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your ass I'm gonna proceed. He turns on the drill:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is empty, quiet.  A lone police black-and-whit pulls out of the shadows of a side street and begins a sl cruise toward the Nakatomi building.

dialogues.speaker: ON POWELL
dialogues.text: Driving, alone.  He starts up at the tower.  It seems cal its glowing lights matching the warmth of the holiday decorations on the streets.  Powell slows to a stop and scans the premises.  In the lobby we SEE Eddie, sitting b the desk.  Powell reports to his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard inside.  No signs of disturbance ...I'm going up for a closer look. He pulls in and parks in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane punches out a ceiling vent and drops down into th machine room.  For a moment he stands, listening for soun of movement.  The floor is quiet.  He goes to the stairwe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The edge of the roof.  Suddenly a tall terrorist, James, moves along the wall and looks over at Powell's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open on Karl, Franco and Fritz.  They step out onto the darkened floor.  We SEE large number "3 painted on the doors of this floor. They move quickly toward the windows on the Avenue of the side where a terrorist, ALEXANDER, with a BAR rifle has s a machine gun nest under a half-opened window.  Directly him we SEE Powell's car. Alexander PANS the police car with his weapon, finger on trigger.  This is clearly a man hungry for action.

dialogues.speaker: 30TH FLOOR, (HANS' OFFICE)
dialogues.text: Hans watches from above.  He raises his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his usual calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie picks up his CB.  He watches Powell coming up the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had a feeling you'd be calling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him in. Eddie is a little startled, but he moves quickly.

dialogues.speaker: 149-A ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: also hears this, and his eager expression fades.  But ord are orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell tries the front doors.  Locked.  Eddie comes hustl across and unlocks the door with the magnetic card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, officer.  What's up? Powell steps in and looks around.  Bland HOLIDAY MUZAK fi from Speakers here.   (LET IT SNOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got an emergency call that there was a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane makes his way to the Avenue of the Stars side of the building, enters the board room where Takagi was shot McClane goes to the windows and looks down at the street. 152     HIS P.O.V. Powell's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! McClane waits, expectant.  Five seconds.  Ten seconds.  B no commotion, no shouting.  He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the fucking cavalry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell walks casually across the slick floor, eyes pannin area.  Eddie sits casually watching a game on one of his monitor screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already had that false alarm, you ask me, the Goddamn computers sent you out on another wild goose chase. They been chasing bugs in that system since they installed it. (to the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, come on, I got fifty bucks on you assholes -- ! Powell's face shows us he's starting to think he's wastin time.

dialogues.speaker: 153-A WITH MCCLANE
dialogues.text: The silent tension is driving him crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...who's in that car, Stevie Wonder? He makes up his mind.  He lifts one of the big chairs and swings it at the window.  The tempered glass whitens on t first blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sees the glass whiten below him and shouts into his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heinrich hears the radio and shouts to Marco who grabs hi machine gun and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie watches confidently as Powell moves through the lob looking for signs of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: 154-A AROUND THE CORNER FROM POWELL
dialogues.text: Uli is there, gun held ready. 155     BOARD ROOM - 34th FLOOR McClane draws the chair back for the final hit when a ter (MARCO) appears at the door.
