Both men react, but Marco a has his gun up.  He FIRES a round at McClane.  The bullet into the table top and the chair, and McClane goes down b the table.

dialogues.speaker: 156-A
dialogues.text: 157     INT. 34th FLOOR - BOARD ROOM Marco smiles and moves around to the other side of the ta but finds no one.  He looks around frantically than squat beneath the table and sees:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: lying prone, his pistol trained on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it or you're a rugstain.

dialogues.speaker: BOARD ROOM DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Just then Heinrich, the terrorist steps into the doorway, the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco, duck! Marco dives sideways, but Heinrich still isn't quick enou McClane FIRES TWICE and Heinrich DROPS sprawling in the h machine gun FIRING BLINDLY until he hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: 159-A HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: They can FAINTLY HEAR the gunshots.  Holly pales:

dialogues.speaker: 159-B THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: All Powell can hear here is "LET IT SNOW, LET IT SNOW." STOPS just a yard from seeing the armed terrorist, turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw this. He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: 159-C THE BOARD ROOM
dialogues.text: Marco springs on top of the huge table.  McClane rolls on back so he can cover either angle but it is clear that Ma is in the more enviable position.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: on the table top slams in a fresh magazine and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time -- don't hesitate. He leans his machine gun over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: aims directly above him and fires twice into the undersid of the table.  The bullets rip through the table and Marc who DROPS beside McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell heads for the door.  Eddie moves to lock up after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to water your time.  Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane rolls out from under the table, goes to the windo and looks down in time to see Powell heading for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, please, no -- Desperate, he leans on the glass...which CRACKS again, on verge of going.  McClane thinks...looks over his shoulder the body of Marco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell check in on his radio.  Unconsciously he begins to HUM the Muzak he overheard in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Adam Ten to 6421.  We had a wild goose chase on that 436. Everything's okay here.  Over. (waiting, loosening his tie, he murmurs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Oh, the weather outside is frightful, but the...the uh, dum, de dum's delightful...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, One Adam Ten.  We thought it was a crank call anyway.  Clear to code eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. (putting the car into gear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...let is snow, let it snow, let it snow -- ' Suddenly Marco's body CRASHES onto the hood of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jesus H. Christ! (grabbing for his radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6421, this is One Adam Ten -- Suddenly a barrage of MACHINE GUN FIRE from Alexander on third floor drowns out his call!  Powell ducks and flatte against the seat as bullets blow out the front window, covering him in glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, One Adam Ten, please repeat. But Powell accelerates in reverse away from the building, keeping his head low and praying he doesn't hit anything as the bullets follow him, digging into asphalt.  A half away his car runs off the pavement and down a SLOPE, fina BOUNCING to a jarring HALT in a parking lot which is dest to become police H.Q. a few pages from now.  Powell sits and clutches the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Adam Ten, under automatic rifle fire at Nakatomi!  Requesting immediate backup and SWAT assistance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane looks down at Powell and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the party, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN FROM A POLICE SCANNER.  We take in the action here, all color coordination and slickness.  RICHARD THORNBURG, local TV news reporter, is on the phone to his girlfriend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of course I can get us a table, Wolfgang and me, we're like that. I interviewed him...hold on,                         * babe... He covers the mouthpiece, because he's become aware of wh coming from the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (various voices)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- attention all units.  Officer pinned down by automatic weapon fire at Nakatomi, Century City -- request assistant -- (ETC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intermixed with all this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- guys, you want to cut through the red tape?  They practically turned this car into Swiss cheese -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right...! He drops the phone, pick up another.  Shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, this is Dick.  I want a remote truck and a crew to meet me at the South gate in fifteen minutes... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right, fifteen... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? (Hearing gun shots)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an Emmy! Now, hearing MACHINE GUN FIRE, Thornburg hangs up the sec phone.  Runs out of the room.  CAMERA PANS BACK TO the fi phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard?  Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirens wail as the first few police cars arrive.  Powell them, waves them back, points to the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back and closes his eyes, luxuriating in the sou of WAILING POLICE SIRENS.  He looks at Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never through I'd love to hear that sound.

dialogues.speaker: HANS' OFFICE
dialogues.text: Hans, Karl, Fritz and Franco confer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-speech)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- all of you, stay at your posts! We knew that police action was inevitable... (an odd smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In fact, it's necessary.  So let them start their feeble efforts; until them, stay calm.  We have the hostages, remember.  We are still in charge. Suddenly Hans' CB crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking it up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told all of you...I want radio silence until further --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 169-A   MCCLANE - 34th FLOOR - BOARD ROOM He's got a CB on the table and ON, and his cop's notebook out again.  He's already upgraded the NUMBER OF TERRORIST to "12 (?) minus 3 = 9" and added other information.  As speaks he takes ammo clips the dead men dropped, their sidearms, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm sorry, Hans, nobody gave me the message.  You shoulda put it on the bulletin board.  Anyway, I thought you and Franco and Karl and the other boys might be lonely, now that I waxed Tony and Marco and their buddy.  So I invited some of the guys from my card game. In the office, the terrorists REACT, startled, as McClane name-drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How...how does he know so much about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving for silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, how nice of you to call.  I assume you are our mysterious party crasher.  You are most troublesome for a...security guard? 170     INT. 34th FLOOR - ON MCCLANE - INTERCUT Moving down the corridor.  Now armed with Marco's machine gun and carrying Heinrich's kit bag, he seems more lethal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BZZZ!  Sorry, Hans, wrong guess. Would you like to go for Double Jeopardy, where the stakes are double and the scores really change? He rolls Heinrich over and is delighted to find a pack of Gauloise's in the man's pocket.  He takes them, pats the dead man's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to the body)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad for your health anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the fly in the ointment, Hans. The monkey in the wrench, the pain in the ass - McClane STOPS in mid-speech.  He's just opened the kit ba Heinrich had over his shoulder when he died.  Now McClane takes out the contents...dozens and dozens of EXPLOSIVE DETONATORS marked "DANGER" and a CHUNK of cello-wrapped PLASTIQUE the size of an electric razor.  He WHISTLES in surprise to himself. In the office, Hans turns off his mike for a moment, turn to Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check on all the others...don't use the radio.  See if he's lying about Marco  and find out if anyone                  * else is missing.                                     * He moves.   Hans goes back onto the CB.  Meanwhile, McCla SMILES at the tell-tale STATIC as Hans goes off and on. knows what's happening.  Now, he starts to walk down a corridor, eyes PANNING FROM elevator to the stairwell doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mystery Guest.  Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't think of leaving, Hans. Unless you want to open the front door...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not.  But you have me at a loss -- you know my name, but who are you? (scornfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just another American who saw too many movies as a child.  Another orphan of a bankrupt culture who thinks he's John Wayne...Rambo... Marshal Dillion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was always partial to Roy Rogers.  I really dug those sequined shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think you have a chance against us, Mr. Cowboy? A LIGHT blinks on the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yipee-yi-yea...mother-fucker. McClane goes quietly through the stairwell door and is go by the time the search party steps onto this floor. Hans sits quietly...thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl steps off the elevator and goes through the crowd of hostages to Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't lying about Marco:  He's thirty stories down on the street. The other man is Heinrich, and I found his body upstairs. (pause; Hans looks alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his bag is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had the detonators! (into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo?  Theo!

dialogues.speaker: 171-A THEO
dialogues.text: With Kristoff, he has DRILLED TWO HOLES in the safe and i working on a third when he HEARS the CB.  He turns off th drill, answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may have some problems.  How is your schedule? Theo moves to his computer screen which shows a schematic the safe and blinking icons and the words MECHANICALS #2 and #2 DISABLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three down, four to go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't waste time talking to me. Suddenly all REACT to a nearby CB transmitter which broad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sergeant Al Powell of the Los Angeles Police Department.  If the person who radioed for help on this channel can hear me, acknowledge this transmission...I say again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read you, Powell.  You the guy in the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell stands in front of his destroyed cruiser and looks up at the building.  Behind him technicians, City Power a Light personnel, SWAT officers in protective gear, etc., from all directions.  A trailer is being backed into a pa lot, which will become the police center of operations. is like watching a small town being constructed right bef your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's left of him.  Can you identify yourself?

dialogues.speaker: 173-A HANS AND KARL
dialogues.text: Listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later.  Just listen fast because this is a party line and the neighbors are trigger happy. Now here's the skinny:  There's thirty or so hostages on the 30th floor, with probably 2 or 3 guards to cover a group that size. The leader here is named Hans, and besides the pea shooter he ventilated your car with,                            * they got machine guns and                            * sidearms up the yin yang.  On top of that one of 'em had a big enough chunck of plastic explosive to orbit Kate Smith.                                    * NOTE:  The following dialogue is said OVER McClane's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find him and shut him up!  He's telling them everything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head, calming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are irrelevant.  We've                    * waiting for the FBI.  Until they                     * arrive, we can't finish out work. Meanwhile, let this fool waste time for the police.  Fritz, go help Uli                  * find the bag. The CAMERA TIGHTENS ON him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must find those detonators. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figuring there's at least one to cover the lobby, a couple with the hostages...I'd say they came in with about a dozen...but they're down to nine now, including the skydiver you already met.  These guys are mostly Europeans, judging by their clothing labels, and they're well financed and very slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen enough phoney ID's in my time to recognize that the ones they've got cost a fortune.  Add all that up and I don't know what the fuck it means, but these are bad ass preps and they're here to stay. We notice that everything McClane has said about "clothin and ID's and police jargon, etc., has set off a little bu in Powell's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you... (on a hunch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partner.  And LA's finest are on it, so light 'em if you got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ahead of you...partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what do I call you? A moment.  McClane smiles.  What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Roy'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it...'Roy'.  Now listen.  If you think of anything else you think we need to know, don't be shy, okay? In the meantime I want you to find a safe place and hole-up and let us do our job.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all yours, Al.  Good luck. McClane turns off his CB and sits against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked police car pulls up across the street from Nakatomi building and a MAN in a sportcoat climbs out. Stocky, his hair a little too perfect, the very fact that he is the Deputy Chief of Police Operations on a Christma gives some evidence to his position in the pecking order. name is DWAYNE T. ROBINSON and he moves brusquely past po technicians and goes to the forward group of officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's talking to them? Powell turns around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, Sir...Sergeant Al Powell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne Robinson.  Well, what have you learned?  What do they want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorists?  Don't know, Sir. We haven't heard a peep from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who the hell have you been talking too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't exactly know, Sir.  He won't give us him name.  He appears to be the man who called in the report...he's killed one of the terrorists for sure and claims he capped two others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He claims?  Powell, has it occured to you he could be one of the terrorists, pulling your chain? Or some kind of nut case who --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, Sir.  In fact... I think he's a cop.  Maybe not LAPD, but definitely a badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hunch.  Things he said.  Like, knowing how to recognize a phony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- recognizing phony ID's?  Christ, Powell, he could be a fucking bartender for all we know! Something draws Robinson's attention.  He looks at:

dialogues.speaker: REMOTE NEWS TRUCK
dialogues.text: Pulling up and parking just beyond the barricades. Richard Thornburg gets out, starts supervising the positioning of cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Hans examines building plans at Holly's desk.  Behind him the TV is ON, the sound muted.  TV cops triumph over oafi bad guys. Hans looks up as Fritz brings in Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...have a request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  What idiot put you in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. (on his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murdered by Boss.  Now... (waving towards the hostages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looking to me.  Personally I'd pass on the jab.  I don't enjoy being this close to you. Hans is impressed by her candor.  And she's easy enough on the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a pregnant woman out there -- (on his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- relax, she's not due for two weeks, but a marble floor isn't doing her back any good.  I'd like permission for her to more to one of the offices where there's a sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I'll have a sofa brought out to you.  Good enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough.  And unless you like is messy, you'd better start taking us in groups to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you're right.  It will be done. He nods to one of his men, and she is waved to the door: As she goes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Takagi chose his people well, Mrs...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennero.  Miss Gennero. He nods, thoughtful.  She goes out.  Hans suddenly notice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slide "SPECIAL BULLETIN" has appeared.  This changes to SHOT of the Nakatomi building with "LIVE" supered over it Richard Thornburg is in front. The CAMERA TIGHTENS ON him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Richard Thornburg, speaking to you live from Century City... where Los Angeles has joined the sad but world wide fraternity whose only membership requirement is the awesome spectre of International Terrorism...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: As Thornburg Continues, we PULL BACK.  We're WITH Argyle the back seat of the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for the remote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is new...? The CAMERA PULLS BACK and we SEE the Nakatomi Building ri up in the b.g. behind Thornburg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're told that the situation began some two hours ago when an unidentified party of men took over the building and sealed off all of its entrances and exits... Argyle is already bailing out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle looks at the metal gates, swallows.  He JUMPS back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE
dialogues.text: Argyle pours himself a stiff drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since all the telephone lines have been cut, the only contact with the building had been through the use of CB communicators which the terrorists brought with them.  Strangely enough, so far the terrorists have not communicated directly with the police... but an unidentified man has had several conversations which seem to indicate... Argyle nearly spills his drink as he leans over the front seat and turns on the CB.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Signs of activity along the edges and shadows of the area Men and vehicles.  The SNAP of weapons and breeches. Footsteps running in unison.  Powell picks up on this, tu to Robinson, who is standing with the SWAT Captain, MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like?  We're going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flabbergasted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going in...are you out of your mind? There's 30 hostages in there -- for all we know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- all we know?  We don't know shit, Powell.  If there's hostages why hasn't anyone asked for ransom?  If there's terrorists, where's their goddamn list of demands?  All we know is that someone shot up your car, and it could be the same flake you've been talking to on the radio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the body that fell out of the window -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell knows?  Maybe he was a stockbroker who looked at the Dow Jones and opted for early retirement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, we're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin your reconnoiter.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Inside the building, sadly realizing that the Marlboro pa has only two more to go.  He savors the dregs of his curr number, then suddenly becomes aware of an almost EERIE QU He moves to the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Hints of activity in the darkness.  A LIGHT FLARES exting Shadows move on trailer walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spooked, into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell?  Al, you still with me? What's going on?  Al?

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Powell stiffens.  Robinson looks at him warningly, shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Roy, but I'm, uh, kind of busy.  Let's talk later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al, what's wrong?  Did something -- (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh, God.  You're coming in!  That's it, isn't it?  Christ, Powell, I told you what you're dealing with here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said we'll talk later, Roy.  If you're what I think you are you should know when to listen, when to shut up... and when to pray. Hating himself, Powell DISCONNECTS, watches LIGHTS snaps the parking lot to illuminate the area. Also hating himself, McClane does the same thing.  Pale, moves to a window to watch what he knows is going to be b

dialogues.speaker: 188-A IN HOLLY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: He hunches over his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be coming.  Get ready. Theo, watch the screens.  Be our eyes and ears. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait until they're close.

dialogues.speaker: 188-B EDDIE
dialogues.text: slips away from the desk, a computer card in his hand.  H meets up with another terrorist and they move behind a sl in the wall.  Eddie waves his card at the sensor and a ME GRID crashes into place.  They hold their weapons behind ready.

dialogues.speaker: TERRORISTS
dialogues.text: All now with earplugs in their CB's, taking up positions:

dialogues.speaker: AT THE LOBBY DOOR
dialogues.text: The SWAT team leader moves in SOP style to the door, scan carefully.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE BARRICADES
dialogues.text: Mitchell listens to CB radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in position. Mitchell looks at Robinson, who is visible tense.  Robins hesitates, then gives his approval with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECURITY CAMERAS on the walls PAN and ZOOM:

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT DOOR
dialogues.text: Kristoff DRILLS AWAY, is rewarded with the message FIFTH DEACTIVATED.  DO YOU WISH TO CONTINUE?  Nearby, Theo sits a bank of monitors.  Screen after screen pinpoints all th police activity outside, down to the last detail.  Theo S Suddenly we RECOGNIZE that tune he's been whistling.  It' "Singin' In The Rain."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a throat mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the night before Xmas, and all through the house, not a creature was stirring, expect for the four assholes coming in the rear in standard 2 X 2 cover formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and another terrorist, ULI, take up prone firing positions, using the gaps in the steel partition like gun

dialogues.speaker: TWO SWAT OFFICERS
dialogues.text: Mitchell and Robinson watch from behind the cover of a po car as the SWAT officers remove a portable welding torch begin cutting their way through the locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves painfully to the window and looks out.  He can't a thing because of the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly rifle fire sounds from the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worriedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shooting at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's panic fire...they can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shooting at the lights. More shots ring out from the building going over the SWAT officers' heads and suddenly the huge dome of one of the spotlights shatters behind Mitchell and Robinson's head. The glow fades.  A moment later the next light twenty fee away dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going after the lights! The two SWAT officers cutting the garage ate suddenly loo as their cover starts to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're almost in. Suddenly the third and fourth lights are shot out and the men become sitting ducks.

dialogues.speaker: IN HOLLY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: He calmly speak into his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get impatient.  Just wound them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Uli fire.  They hit one of the officers in the the second one in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send in the car! An armored car wheels toward the building and starts towa the wounded men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and Alexander quickly load two crates onto the serv elevator and push the button for the 3rd floor.  As the c starts down, they remove an anti-tank gun from one of the crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what have we here.  The police've got themselves an R.V. James, Alexander, southeast corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service elevator arrives on the 3rd floor and James a Alexander move across the room toward the windows with th anti-tank weapon.  At the window, they prepare the weapon for use. Outside the window the armored car has stopped in front o wounded man and paramedics quickly load them in from the sheltered side of the vehicle.  Alexander quickly sights the armored car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hans, CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s., over CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast ROARS from the third floor window and the shell h the armored car.  The car pitches forward like a beast wh front legs have been shot out from under it -- its front destroyed, unable to move.  Alexander looks back at James grins.

dialogues.speaker: 30TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: He watches from his window.  Coldly picks up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it again.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: listening.  He picks up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans, you motherfucker, you've made your point.  Let them pull back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Mr. Cowboy, I'll take it under advisement.  His it again. McClane slumps to the floor below the window.  He feels helpless, then notices his kit bag.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD FLOOR
dialogues.text: James runs back to the crate on the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look on in horror as the armored car sits helplessly fire.  On the police radio channel we HEAR the screams of inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rivers!  Rodriguiz!...Report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over; on radio, yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rivers.  We've got one dead. Everybody's hit.  Rodriguiz's bleeding bad.  We've got to get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rivers, hang on!  That's an order! Hang on, we'll get you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James opens the box of shells and takes two and starts ba across the room.

dialogues.speaker: EXPLOSIVE
dialogues.text: Like a football.  It sits on the seat of a secretary's ch with castors.  We PULL BACK TO SEE McClane press three detonators into the top, then cover the explosive with a typewriter, tying it securely in place with electrical co

dialogues.speaker: SERVICE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: wheels the chair to the service elevator, opens the door block them with a fire axe.  He looks in -- the top of th can just be seen thirty-five floors below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James hands the shell to Alexander, who expertly loads it the anti-tank gun. Alexaneder lifts the  gun to his shoul and aims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane push the chair into the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geronimo...motherfuckers. For a long moment there is nothing, then:  the shaft is f with light, then SOUND -- an ungodly ROAR -- and McClane thrown back across the elevator corridor against the othe back of doors by the concussion wave.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE 3RD FLOOR
dialogues.text: The explosion, like a firestorm, rips across the floor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police take cover behind their cars.  Powell, Robinso and Mitchell look like they've seen the face of God as th building rocks from the blast.  Henry's cigarette falls f his mouth as a desk is sent hurtling across Avenue of the into the trees across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching it on TV, feeling it all around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Thornburg's crew is taping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in awe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unreal. (to the cameraman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Thornburg looks at his competitors still setting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat your heart out, Channel Four.

dialogues.speaker: ON HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: The hostages are shaken and the terrorists guarding them aren't too sure of themselves either.  Only Hans is relat calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're using artillery on us -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot, it's not the police... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: She comforts Ginny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up and lifts the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al!  Al, the guys in the car, did they make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the street, watching as the survivors are pulled out o wreck and to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe and sound, thanks to you. What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plastique I found. (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the building on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's gonna need one hell of a paint job and a shitload of screen doors. (looking off, nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One spotters say you got two with that blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two?  Are you sure? Before Powell can answer Robinson comes running up to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for Powell's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that. (angrily at McClane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen to me, mister, I don't know what you think you're doing, but demolishing a building doesn't fall under the definition of 'help'! There's hundreds of people out here and you covered half of them in pieces of glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, my ass!  Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Deputy Chief of Police Dwayne T. Robinson, and I'm in charge of this situation. McClane leans tiredly against the elevator door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, from up here, it looks like you're in charge of shit, Dwayne. I haven't seen such a fucked up operation since the Bride of Frankenstein.  Ask the guys in the armored car if they minded a little flying glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen asshole -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole?  I'm not the one who just for butt fucked on national TV, Dwayne!  Now if you're not part of the solution, stop being part of the problem!  Get off the Goddamn radio and put Al back on! McClane is so furious, he's out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argyle nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em, Mr. Mac!  Tell 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still seething.  There is a long pause on the CB, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Roy.  How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty fucking unappreciated.

dialogues.speaker: ON POWELL
dialogues.text: Other officers, including Robinson, monitor the conversat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I love you. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do a lot of the guys.  So hang in there, man.  Hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired, touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...partner.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: As it SNAPS ON.  We're in the studio set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the picture stabilizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...of the Nakatomi building, sources say that the terrorist leader 'Hans' may be this man, Hans Gruber. A SLIDE of Hans appears behind her.  At the same time, th PULLS BACK.  We realize we're on THE HOSTAGE FLOOR, and H has just turned on the set out here for his "guests".  He modestly as they "recognize" him from the on air shot, re to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A member of the radical West German Volksfrei movement. Strangely, the Volksfrei leadership issued a communique an hour ago stating that Gruber has been expelled from the organization and is operating on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, Gail whatever his affiliation, it's safe to say that Gruber's terrorist actions in Los Angeles tonight are well, terroristic... As the bullshit continues, Ellis suddenly STANDS, head to the terrorist "office".  Immediately the chief guard here Fritz, moves to intercept Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of sitting here waiting to see who gets us killed first... them...or your husband. (to the approaching Fritz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I negotiate million dollar deals for breakfast.  I can handle these clowns. (to Fritz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Hans.  Hans! Sprickenzie talk? He doesn't wait for an answer.  Fritz follows him.  Holly worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-speech, angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you wouldn't let me kill him when I had the chance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd listened to me he would be neutralized already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want neutral...I want dead -- ALL TURN at a rap on the door.  Ellis is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope I'm not interrupting...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fritz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want? As Fritz shrugs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what I want, it's what I can give you.  Look, let's be straight, okay?  It's obvious you're not some dumb thug up here to snatch a few purses, am I right? Karl looks at Ellis and then at Hans, as if to say, let m this asshole right now.  But Hans is either amused of cur or bored enough to shake his head, turn back to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very perceptive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flattered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I read the papers, I watch 60 minutes, I say to myself, these guys are professionals, they're motivated, they're happening. They want something.  Now, personally, I don't care about your politics. Maybe you're pissed at the Camel Jockeys, maybe it's the Hebes, Northern Ireland, that's none of my business.  I figure, You're here to negotiate, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're amazing.  You figured this all out already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, business is business.  You use a gun, I use a fountain pen, what's the difference?  To put it in my terms, you're here on a hostile takeover and you grab us for some greenmail but you didn't expect a poison pill was gonna be running around the building. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans, baby...I'm your white knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have missed 60 Minutes.  What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy upstairs who's fucking things up?  I can give him to you. As Hans reacts with real interest for the first time, we:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: By the CB.  He suddenly REACTS to a GROAN from McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy!  You all right?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: He's by an open desk drawer, having just ripped open a pa of twinkies he's found.  He grimaces, mouth full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just trying to handle some year old twinkies.  Yucck.  What do they put in these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reciting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sugar, enriched flour, partially hydrogenated vegetable oil, polysorbate 60 and yellow dye #5.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like a man with a couple of kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, the wife in working on our first.  You got any kids back on the ranch? McClane swallows Twinkie with a grimace, takes out his wa flips it open to a picture of himself and Holly and the k in happier days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.  And I'd sure like to see them swinging on the jungle gym with Al junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a date.  You buy the ice cream. McClane laughs, stares at the photo, when suddenly anothe besides Powell's comes over his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s., on CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touching, cowboy, touching. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or should I call you Mister McClane? Mister officer John McClane on the

dialogues.speaker: NYPD
dialogues.text: McClane FREEZES.  How much do they know?

dialogues.speaker: THORNBURG
dialogues.text: Reacts, gleeful, writes down the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the phone to our New York affiliate...move, move!

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: reacts, signals an Aide, who's already writing, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting to stay calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Teresa in third grade called me Mr. McClane.  My friends call me John Mac.  You're neither...shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have someone who wants to talk to you.  A very special friend who was at the party with you tonight. McClane's face falls.  Oh, God.  Eyes closed, he waits fo voice that tells him it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, John boy? McClane's eyes open, showing equal parts of shock and hop In the office, CAMERA ADJUSTS TO SHOW Ellis as Hans gives the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? Ellis has a cigarette, and a terrorist brings him a Diet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, they're giving me a few minutes to try and talk some sense into you. I know you think you're doing your job, and I can appreciate that, but you're just dragging this thing out. None of us gets out of here until these people can negotiate with the LA police, and they're just not gonna start doing that until you stop messing up the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, what have you told them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them we're old friends and you were my guest at the party. McClane sighs, partially relieved.  Hans meanwhile, narro eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis...you shouldn't be doing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. He looks at Hans, who gives him a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right...John, listen to me... They want you to tell them where the detonators are.  They know people are listening.  They want the detonators of they're going to kill me. Ellis gives Hans a big "ok" sign.  Hans returns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and others listening intently.  McClane closes his eyes a leans his head back again.  He knows what is going to hap even if this poor bastard Ellis doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, didn't you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CB, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hear you, you fucking moron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I think you could get with the program a little.  The police are here now.  It's their problem. Tell these guys where the detonators are so no one else gets hurt.  Hey, I'm putting my life on the line for you buddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know that!  Put Hans on!  Hans, listen to me, that shithead doesn't know what kind of scum you are, but I do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Then you'll give us what we want and save your friend's life. You're not part of this equation. It's time to realize that. Saying this, Hans takes out his gun, points it at Ellis, Ellis smiles, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, a method actor?  Hans, babe, put away the gun.  This is radio, not television...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That asshole's not my friend! I barely know him!  I hate his fucking guts -- (desperately sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ellis, for Christ's sake, tell him you don't mean shit to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, how can you say that, after all these years--?  John?  John? Ellis looks at Hans and shrugs, "Well, I tried..." Hans n understandingly.  He takes the CB, presses the TALK butto in one frighteningly smooth motion brings the Walther up Ellis' forehead and PULLS THE TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was expecting the SHOT but it still chills him.

dialogues.speaker: 30TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: She lowers her head sadly.  Around her, the others go CRA they SEE Ellis' blood splattered on the glass walls on Ha office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open the door to let McClane and the police hea screams of the hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that?  Talk to me, where are my detonators.  Where are they or shall I shoot another one?  Sooner or later... (taking a shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I might get to someone you do care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself. He DISCONNECTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell fends off Robinson, who wants the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, didn't you hear him!  He practically pulled the Goddamned trigger himself -- he gave that man to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, can't you read between the lines!  He did everything he could to save him...if he gave himself up they'd both be dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  And maybe they'd at least be talking to us!  Now tell your 'partner' to stay out of it, or so help me if he lives through this I'll put him behind bars myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alone, tired, hunted, and hasn't seen diddly-squat from us and you think he gives a flying fuck about what you're going to do to him? Robinson, wake up and smell the shit you're shoveling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime you want to go home, Sergeant...consider yourself dismissed. They lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir.  You couldn't drag me away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention police.  Attention police. It's asses and elbows time.  Tape recorders are started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to speak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the CB away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Deputy Chief Robinson.  Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Hans Gruber.  I assume you realize the futility of direct action against me.  We have no wish for further loss of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wish for, Mister Gruber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have comrades in arms around the world who are languishing in prison. The American State Department enjoys rattling its saber to its own ends... now it can rattle it for me.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Listening to this with expressions ranging from astonishm to dismay to outright derisive amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The following people are to be released from their captors:  In Northern Ireland, the seven members of the New Provo Front.  In Canada, the five imprisoned leaders of Liberte de Quebec...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in Sri Lanka, the nine members of the Asian Dawn movement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Asian Dawn Movement?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off-mike, a shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about them in Time magazine. (on mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When these Revolutionary Brothers and Sisters are Free, the hostages in this building will be taken to the roof and they will accompany us in helicopters to the Los Angeles International Airport where you will be given further instructions.  You have two hours to comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours?  Are you insane?  I can't authorize...hello?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they'll even try to do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? (on another channel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo.  Are we on schedule?

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Theo and Kristoff have been rewarded with another LOCK DEACTIVATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more to go...then it's up to you. The graphic on his screen flashes:  "WARNING:  ELECTRO-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you better be right, because this one's going to take a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas, Theo, it's the time of miracles.  So be of good cheer and call me when you hit the last lock. (disconnecting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl...hunt the little shit down and get those detonators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franco is checking the explosives, Fritz is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check the explosives.  You just get those detonators.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: As he talks, he essentially PATROLS the floor he's staked out, constantly looking into every dark corner, gun held ready, moving toward the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al?  Al, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of cows, did you ever hear so much bullshit in your life? Two hours?  That doesn't even make any sense --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, partner.  I'm just a desk jockey who was on the way home when you rang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you drove that car, I figured you for the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my youth, partner.  In my youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gail and Harvey have company, a man from the Senator Paul Simon's school of grooming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-speech)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...author of... (holding up a copy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hostage/Terrorist, Terrorist/Hostage, a Study in Duality.'  Dr. Hasseldorf, what can we expect in the next few hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Gail, by this time the hostages and their captors should be entering the early stages of the Helsinki Syndrome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in Helsinki, Sweden?

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Sam sighs, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Finland.  Basically, it's when the hostages and the terrorists go through a sort of psychological transference and projection of dependency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritz drags Ellis' body out of the office and throws it o floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Hans' TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can only be described as a strange sort of trust and bond develops...We've had situations where hostages have embraced their captors after their release and in one case even corresponded with them in prison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans turns, looks up at the ceiling.  Too dim up there to from here.  He sighs, sets his gun down on a buttress, st to climb up, not enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Robinson looks at a YOUNG COP, reacts, startled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The...the FBI?  Here?  Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.  Right over there. Robinson looks at Powell, adjusts his clothing, fixes his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a breath mint? Robinson glares at him, then they move together towards:

dialogues.speaker: A BIG DARK GOVERNMENT CAR
dialogues.text: Headlights still on, dominating the area where it sits. steps up, sees:

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENTS
dialogues.text: They get out.  One big back lit SILHOUETTE, one little on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Special Agent Johnson of the FBI. This is Agent Johnson...no relation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping forward, plastic smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne Robinson, LAPD.  I'm in charge here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more. As Robinson REACTS, we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE MECHANICAL FLOOR
dialogues.text: He checks the plastique, not pleased.  He turns, DROPS to floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands, knees bent...looks directly at a PAIR OF BARE F A GUN BARREL DROPS INTO THE SHOT close to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.  And then Hans turns, looks up. The transformation in his expression and bearing are mind boggling.  Hands shaking, eyes filled with fear, he swall looks up at McClane and in a perfect American accent says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --ohGodplease -- don't kill me -- don't kill me -- you're one of them, I know it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown, unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, easy man.  I won't hurt you.  Who are you?  What are you looking for? Hans' eyes dart towards:

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTTRESS TEN FEET AWAY
dialogues.text: Where a tiny piece of his gun sticks out, barely visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A way up to the roof...I thought I could signal for help -- He starts in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  They got a guy up there. You want to stay alive, keep moving. Hey?  You hear me? Hans realizes this tack won't work.  He follows McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you're an American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly, easing the man's fears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if New Jersey counts. It works.  The poor frightened civilian shows a hint of a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-speech to FBI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got thirty, maybe thirty-five hostages, probably on the 30th floor... seven, maybe eight terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Big Johnson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a standard A-7 scenario. Big Johnson nods in agreement, turns to Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  We'll handle it from here.  When we need to commandeer your men, we'll try and let you know. He starts to move away with his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something? Johnson and Johnson turn.  Robinson wants Powell to shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John McClane!  He's the man who gave us all the information we've got! He's the reason you're facing seven terrorists instead of twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's inside?  Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be a cop...we're checking on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's not a terrorist, and he's not a hostage...he's just not part of the equation. They start to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T...that's the same Goddamn thing the terrorists said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (to Big Johnson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one good thing.  Sound like we're dealing with pros. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane and Hans walk together.  Hans is still a "nervous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a party -- celebration -- all of a sudden they were there -- shooting -- threatening us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane looks at this poor civilian, on the edge of going pieces.  He puts his hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, man...you smoke? Hans nods, still "frightened".  McClane takes out his spo of war, the Marlboros.  Two left.  He sighs, takes one, o the other one with an expression like a little boy forced share a cookie.  McClane takes out a lighter, does his an Hans'.  Hans nods, grateful...then peers at McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you don't work for Nakatomi... and if you're not one of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cop from New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They invited me to the Xmas party. Who knew? Hans' eyes take in his bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than being caught with your pants down, right? (extending his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Clay. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Bill. McClane nods, friendly like, and his eyes glance casually at:

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: In alphabetical order.  CAMERA MOVES OVER the "c's":  CAM S.: CLAY, WM.: CRAWFORD, L...PANS BACK TO CLAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you know how to use a handgun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One weekend I went to a combat ranch... (apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that game with the, the guns that shoot red paint?  Must sound pretty silly to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds better than nothing. McClane takes out his Baretta, pops out the magazine, jam a fresh one and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for the real thing. McClane turns, moves on...we STAY ON him until he REACTS CLICK.  He slowly turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans is...well, Hans again, from expression to posture. holds the pistol aimed at McClane's face and talks calmly his radio in German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl!  Franco!  I'm on 33.  Come quickly. (to McClane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down your gun and give me my detonators. McClane just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans.  Your Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, indicating McClane's gun again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was tricky, with the accent. I bet you do a great Ed Sullivan. Why do you need the detonators, Hans? I already used the explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to count to three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Like you did with Takagi. McClane raises his machine gun, aims at Hans.  Hans PULLS TRIGGER. Click.  Astonishment.  Click-click-click.  McClane steps carefully, reclaims his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a shmuch, Hans. Hans pales as we hear the ding of an approaching elevator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying. McClane whirls in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: KARL, FRANCO AND FRITZ
dialogues.text: Coming out of it, FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane FIRES back, killing Fritz.  Karl and Franco take cover.  McClane ducks into a water cooler alcove, looks b at:

dialogues.speaker: WHERE HANS WAS
dialogues.text: He's gone, a SWINGING OFFICE DOOR the only evidence of hi passing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane curses himself, then RETREATS into a:

dialogues.speaker: BANK OF COMPUTERS
dialogues.text: Where he DUCKS and DODGES as bullets ping and ricochet al around him.  Ducking, rolling, he FIRES at:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCO
dialogues.text: McClane's bullets RAKE his middle, throw him over a desk, weapon FLYING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLIDES right into a glass door.  It smashes around his Bright arterial BLOOD fountains up:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: hope rising at the prospect of an equal battle, his face suddenly FALLS as BULLETS fly in from an unexpected direc He turns:

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: has reappeared and snatched up Franco's weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: FIRES, moving, trying to keep from bring flanked.  One of shots SHATTERS a glass panel, raining down shards near Ha who escapes with only superficial scratches.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: looks at the glass around him, gets an idea.  He SHOUTS t Karl in German:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass!  Shoot the glass! And, saying this, he demonstrates.  Karl follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: as GLASS FLIES EVERYWHERE, McClane sees one option, takes BLASTING a burst to keep their heads down, he WHIRLS, JUM on top of a long counter and RUNS ACROSS THE ROOM.  Their BULLETS follow him, six inches behind his moving form!  B CRAY UNITS GROAN with electronic SQUEALS and SPARKS as a million Gigabytes goes to RAM heaven.  McClane reaches th of the counter, DIVES and rolls to the floor:

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOOT
dialogues.text: goes right down on a jagged SHARD.  He GROANS, keeps goin

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL DOOR
dialogues.text: He's out, gone, safe!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Karl looks pissed as hell.  Behind him, Hans sifts throug rubble, then comes over, smiling. He's holding the bag of detonators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile, Karl.  We are back in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor here)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all depends on what we mean by "Terror.'  If Clauswitz could say 'War is the last resort of Deplomacy,' couldn't we just as well say that terrorism has an equal claim to... Mary comes inside, grinning ear to ear.  Thornburg looks his danish, a cute little chin napkin protecting his shir collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving a paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just McClane's name, badge number, police record, vital statistics... (the ringer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And his family's address right here in L.A. As Thornburg GRINS we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Eddie and Uli are guarding the hostages.  Hans and Karl r Hans tosses the bag of detonators to Uli, who grins, leav

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY AND GINNY
dialogues.text: Holly has watched all this nervously.  But Ginny's eyes f Karl, who doesn't share the mood of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one look pissed, Ms. Gennero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: The door JARS open.  McClane all but crawls inside.  As h passes the CAMERA we SEE his dragging foot leaving a trai of blood on the linoleum.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Theo and Kristoff REACT, delighted, as they get the messa SIXTH LOCK DEACTIVATED.  Suddenly a BUZZER SOUNDS and the graphic flashes:  "ELECTROMAGNETIC SEAL ENGAGED.  CANNOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better heat up that miracle                      * you were talking about.  We broke through on Number Six, and the Electromagentic came down like a sledgehammer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unphased)                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well have a look at what our friends outside are doing and I'll be right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wincing in pain, McClane washes his foot in a sink basin. washes a deep cut, soaps it, but the pain doesn't relent. When a VOICE speaks, he JUMPS, realizes it's the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy?  You still with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  But all things being equal, I'd rather be in Philadelphia.  By the way, chalk up two more terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They boys'll be glad.  We got a pool going on you. McClane tries to wrap paper towels on the foot but his gr shows that is still hurts like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  What's the odds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know. Suddenly remembering an NYPD course in first aid from ten ago, McClane removes the improvised bandage, check the cu more carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down for twenty anyway...I'm good for it...so, what got you off the street, Al?  You liked lousy coffee, or what? Powell doesn't answer right away.  At the same time, McCl swallows, seeing a gleam inside his foot.  He gingerly pr and pulls out a shard of glass almost three inches long f angled gash, his mouth twisted in a silent scream all the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...realized I couldn't do what I had to anymore...at least not out there.  I had an...accident. McClane throws the glass across the room, forehead bathed sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They way you drive, I can see why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I shot a kid. Realizing what he's hearing for the first time, McClane's shifts to a new kind of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven years ago.  Oh, it was dark... he was big for his age...damn ray gun he had looked real enough...yeah, I had all the right excuses...but afterwards... I really couldn't draw my gun again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to make a joke of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offhand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you couldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still feel like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this won't matter. (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAPD's not calling the shots anymore. And as McClane REACTS we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans and Theo lean over a monitor watching a DWP truck ne the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the city engineers...they're going into the street circuits...But who are these guys in the suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the FBI...ordering them to cut                * the building's power.  They're as regular as clockwork...or a time lock... ON Theo's look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the circuits that cannot be cut... are cut automatically in reponse to a terrorist incident...You ask for miracles, Theo...I give you the FBI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're hot, you're hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw on Theo's screen, the Johnsons and Robinson and Powell are my a MANHOLE with a CITY ENGINEER.  A big CONT BOX is there, cables snaking into the ground where anothe CITY WORKER finishes WELDING a last connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're spliced in down the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it...now. The engineer THROWS GIANT LEVERS.  Inside the manhole, SP SIZZLE and massive contacts CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: One by one, all the light on all the floors GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: in the bathroom, ripping off his shirt and tying it aroun foot, he REACTS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the FBI.  They've got the terrorist playbook and they're running it, step by step. McClane reacts, worried; he knows better.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: groan with this new problem:

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Theo and Kristoff and Hans huddle over the computer monit screen as if it was a warm fireplace.  Theo points to the computer screen; all they can do is wait. We HEAR the HUMM of a portable generator.  The lights go The computer screen stays ON.  Theo looks over at the saf

dialogues.speaker: SAFE LED READOUT
dialogues.text: It still reads "FIBER OPTIC TIME LOCK CANNOT BE DISARMED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  It didn't go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the building circuit... it's too local.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Encourage them to be bolder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing left for them is the City Grid... (worried, typing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They may not do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the Johnsons are looking SMUG...all the floors GO BACK ON, one by one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! (turning, to the Engineer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it again.  Go wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go wider here... (to Robinson, looking for help)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'd have to call downtown have them take down one of the city grids...you're talking ten square block --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ten blocks? (to Big Johnson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  It's Christmas Eve, thousands of people -- the Mayor'll scream bloody murder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Robinson, to the Engineer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must shut down the building.  Go wider --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need authorization --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization?  How about the United States Fucking Government? Lose the grid or lose your job! The engineer looks at Robinson.  No help.  The engineer l at his guy in the manhole, shrugs.  No choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central.  This is Walt, out at Nakatomi.  I want you to shut down grid 212. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, it's my ass.  Just shut it down now. Pause...pause...AND THEN THE FLOORS OF THE BUILDING ALL G OUT AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY LIGHTING FLICKS ON.   An ALARM "beep-beep-beeps

dialogues.speaker: THE LED READOUT ON THE SAFE
dialogues.text: changes to "FIBER OPTIC TIME LOCK DEACTIVATED AT SOURCE.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: With a dramatic HUM worthy of 2001, the vault door OPENS!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The FBI guys look at the dark building, than at the LAPD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should shake'em up.  With all the power shut down, those bastards are probably scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: The safe door finishes its ponderous move, CLUNKS to a ha Theo and Kristoff LAUGH, give each other high fives.  Eve loses his usual cool, slaps Theo on the back as Theo and Kristoff CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: THORNBURG'S TV TRUCK
dialogues.text: drives along a residential street.  We SEE the Nakatomi t in the b.g., spotlit by the police beams.  Thornburg chec map, POINTS a turn out to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE NAKATOMI BUILDING
dialogues.text: Powell looks up at the dark structure lit only by emergen lighting.  He sidles over to the FBI men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now, arrest them for not paying their electric bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We let them sweat awhile.  Then, when they're expecting helicopters... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We give them helicopters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right up the ass. (into another communicator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Johnson...no the other one.  I want that air support ready to lift off in five minutes...Damn right fully armed.  We're on our way. (into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention in the building.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Hans talks while Theo and Kristoff tackle the problem of unloading the racks and racks of bonds and transferring t to the black cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Hans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Agent Johnson of the FBI. The State Department has arranged for the release of your comrades.  The helicopters you requested are on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you, FBI.  We'll be ready. He disconnects, smiles at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they touch down and we blow the roof, they'll spend a month sifting through the bodies and rubble.  By the time they figure out what went wrong... (smiling at the irony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we'll be earning twenty percent like nice fat Capitalists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disconnecting, grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time he figures out what hit him he'll be in a body bag. The Johnsons exit.  Powell and Robinson look at each othe unhappy.  Powell's CB HISSES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell, listen... Powell moves off to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, John. McClane tries walking on his foot.  He winces in pain, cl at the end of his resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...I'm getting a bad feeling up here...I'd like you to do something for me.  Look up my wife...don't ask how, you'll know by then...and tell her...tell her...I've been a jerk.
