When things panned out for her, I should've been behind her all the way ...We had something great going until I screwed it up...She was the best thing that ever happened to a bum like me.  She's heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never got to hear this...honey...I'm sorry. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.  But you can tell her yourself.  Just watch your ass and you'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.  But that's up to the guy upstairs. (pause; struck by a thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs... (thinking, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hans, you bastard...what were you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, Powell.  I gotta check something out. He moves towards the door, limping hurriedly out of the r

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY'S FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Thornburg's got one foot literally in the doorway, but si Paulina still has the chain on, it's not quite enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paulina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute, that's all we ask.  You could be denying them their last chance to talk to their parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...Mrs. Holly says I couldn't let strangers into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangers?  I'm with KFLW TV, that's affiliated with the FCC, and I'm sure you know that's the United States government...just like the INS? As she wavers...

dialogues.speaker: THE MECHANICAL FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane hobbles in here, favoring his foot.  He retraces steps earlier, mentally replaying his meeting with Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here...he was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes flick over the area...then he looks up.  Seeing something, he moves closer.  He sets down his CB and then difficulty, he climbs up on a thick pipe, flicks his ligh and hold its high. 314     HIS P.O.V. Explosives are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He reacts, quickly extinguishing the lighter.  He follows detonator lines with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... He drops to the floor, winces in pain, picks up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell!  Powell, listen to me!  You're being double crossed!  The whole roof of this building is -- Suddenly a GUN BARREL is pressed against his head.  He st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl takes his Baretta, tosses it away.  Then Karl takes CB.  Smiling, Karl SMASHES the transmitter underfoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell is beside one of the radio monitoring officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy?  Hello?  Hello? (to the officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  He said something about a, a double cross...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing two HELICOPTERS in the distance heading this way.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Karl hovers over McClane, who hasn't moved a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both professionals.  But this is personal.  You...are done. WHAM!  McClane DRIVES his elbow into Karl's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl's weapon clatters on the floor.  McClane follows his blow with another.  Karl recovers, and with a spinning ka kick SLAMS McClane back.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Eddie turns from a window, where the chopper lights loom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming. CAMERA PANS across the room to the doorway of the office, Hans nods, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know you're proud of your daddy...

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: She's speechless, watching in shock as:

dialogues.speaker: THE PORTABLE TV
dialogues.text: shows Thornburg at Holly's house!  He's squatting down wi microphone to interview the children in their P.J.s.  His is soft, comforting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the children)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because he's a very brave policeman. And your mom has shown just as much courage.  But is there something you would like to say to them if they're watching? John Jr. says nothing, but Lucy looks at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come home.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: She struggles to stay composed...can't.  She slowly turns head, looks at Hans.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: He's looking away from us, at the picture of the children her desk.  He turns back and looks at her.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. McClane.  How nice to make your acquaintance. He raises his weapon...but he only shoot it into the ceil making everyone jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your feet, everyone!  Upstairs, now! (quietly, to Uli)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll lock them up there and come right down... Uli nods and he and Eddie help herd everyone towards the Hans moves forward...grabs Holly himself.

dialogues.speaker: THE MACHINE FLOOR
dialogues.text: McClane and Karl move towards each other, each sizing the up, each looking over the terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better this way, isn't it?  I mean, any faggot can shoot a gun. This time Karl doesn't take the bait.  Then, when he does charge, it's unexpected. The two men fight brutally, Karl bringing years of martia training to this moment, McClane bringing nothing but the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've heard your brother scream when I broke his fucking neck... Karl steps in quickly with a deadly move.  McClane twists slams an elbow into Karl's kidney.  Karl backs off, circl McClane with new respect.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE AN FBI CHOPPER
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE CANOPY we SEE another flanking chopper.  John and Johnson are here, helmets and mikes on.  Big Johnson aerial maps while Little Johnson checks ammo clips for hi sniper scoped assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, to the pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay low.  They're expecting transports, not gunships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the noise of the rotors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you figure on breakage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure we take out all the terrorists, and lose 20 percent of the hostages... 25, tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can live with those numbers.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT FLOOR
dialogues.text: Theo and Kristoff load the bonds into the big cases which all their gear when they entered.  As Hans and Eddie come look curiously at Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little bonus for us. (shoving her forward violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A policeman's wife might come in handy. He picks up a CB, speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane!  McClane!  I have some news for you...McClane?

dialogues.speaker: THE MACHINE FLOOR
dialogues.text: TILT UP from the CB radio Karl smashed. Karl and McClane are in the b.g., almost toe to toe, all tricks played out, going at it with animal instinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane? (pause, then on a new channel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl?  Karl? Nothing.  He looks at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Uli herds the hostages up onto the roof, pushing the last out.

dialogues.speaker: FBI CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: They float toward us, hugging the street, their prop wash shaking the trees.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL AND ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Following them with their eyes, for once sharing the same

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGES ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: They see their very own Christmas decorations, the friend copter lights, and begin to smile and cheer.  Uli smiles himself, moves towards the door:

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Theo closes the lid of a bond-stuffed case, carries it ou the room.  Holly's eyes follow his exit while the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hans, scornfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all your posturing, all your speeches...you're nothing but a common thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an exceptional thief, Mrs. McClane. And now that I'm moving up to kidnapping, you should be more polite. He SLAPS her.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Karl drives McClane back with a sweeping head kick.  Anot McClane is staggering.  He gets in one hard punch and the charges at him.  McClane falls backwards, drives his legs upwards, propelling Karl into the air:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl goes into a loop of chain hanging over a turbine, be entangled.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: jumps to his feet, yanks the other end of the chain.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: is JERKED upwards by the neck.  He TWITCHES like a captur fish -- starts to turn blue:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Twists the chain end around a pipe as Karl STILLS.  McCla snatches up his Baretta from the floor, runs out.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: We can SEE the tailing 'chopper through the open port of one.  Big Johnson leans over, slaps the shoulder of his p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like Saigon, eh, Wally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kind of town.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: The door rattles.  His back to the CAMERA, Uli goes to th OPENS it -- and TWO BULLETS COME OUT HIS BACK.  Smoking B in hand, McClane vaults over the body before it has even twitching.  As the hostages SQUEAL and SCREAM, McClane sn up Uli's machine gun, runs out onto the roof.  He charges through the crowd, spots Ginny near the edge of the roof. meets him halfway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Holly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The took her -- after they saw the kids on television --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  God -- He looks off to the choppers.  Closer yet.  He turns, SHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  All of you, get down to the lower floors -- you're all in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, crazy?  We're being rescued!  Those helicopters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- there won't be shit for those helicopters to land on, because the whole top of this building is wired with explosives!  Now get below --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...we're safe up here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe, my ass!  This ain't a helipad, it's a launching pad! And he FIRES over their heads!  They SCREAM, head for the as he hoped!  He FIRES again, raking a line across the ro They really haul ass.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WING CHOPPER
dialogues.text: A YOUNG FBI AGENT is here with a rifle and a partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into throat mike, looking out the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight leader, this is Wing.  I think they're on to us.  One of the terrorists is firing on the hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Wing.  We copy. (to the pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing around. (raising his rifle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a clear shot. The pilot nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (supervising the work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnell, schnell...der zeitz ist kurz... Something catches his eye.  He turns, looks at: 347     VIEW THROUGH WINDOW -- HIS P.O.V. Through the glass here he can catch a glimpse of the host coming back into the room!

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: McClane herds the last of the hostages inside, starts for door himself, when with a ROAR and a CHATTER of rotors, t lead chopper zooms overhead!  McClane throws himself down ground, looks up as the chopper banks in a tight turn and from the open side GUNFIRE erupts!  Shocked, McClane DIVE of the way of the bullets that stitch across the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: descending, SCREAMING and HOWLING as a chopper SWEEPS pas window on a loop back towards the roof.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Both Johnsons FIRE AWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank and we'll nail him!

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Hans whirls towards Kristoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow the roof.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Karl and Uli are up there -- CAMERA ADJUSTS to show the remote detonator on a table. goes to it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: McClane DIVES away from another burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You assholes, I'm on your side -- ! They come in on another pass.  Desperate, he looks around a fire hose.  Makes up his mind.  With the chopper LOOMIN behind him, he slings Uli's weapon, runs to the fire hose unreels three yards, loops it around his back and under h He looks over the edge, hesitates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets HIT all around him.  He JUMPS:

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Hans extends the antenna...HITS the button.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: The helipad EXPLODES!  A FIREBALL rolls into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: lose their footing on the floor.  Dust and debris fall do but they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON AND JOHNSON'S CHOPPER
dialogues.text: STRAINS to avoid the rising fireball...can't!  It's CAUGH the explosion!  It tips over, a rotor hits the roof -- it CRASHES, EXPLODES, tumbles down the side of the building!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Dangling against the side of the building, he DUCKS and w as FLAMING DEBRIS soar past him.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Flame ROARS TOWARDS it, engulfs it.  It JERKS on its foun PIVOTS 180 degrees as several bolts slip:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: DROPS several more feet.  He swallows, then KICKS against side of the building, his bloody feet leaving smears.  Th shatterproof glass doesn't budge!  Wincing as more FLAMIN sizzles by, McClane levels the machine gun, KICKS off fro building, SWINGS back ten feet -- reaches the zenith of h arc -- FIRES the gun and sails back in:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: McClane SMASHES through the shattered glass, SAILS inside onto the floor, PLOWING through furniture and decor.  Fin he STOPS, catches his breath with relief...rises to one k

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: The fire hose mounting is BLASTED off the roof, SAILS pas

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: The hose mechanism tumbles downward!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: McClane is YANKED off his feet, dragged towards the windo

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSE WHEEL
dialogues.text: It SLIDES down the side of the building!  The hose PLAYS on the edge of the windowsill, dragging McClane towards h

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: CLAWS at the floor...no help.  Inches from the shattered he braces his legs against the sill, groans as he fights weight of the hose and the reel.  One foot SLIPS.  Only h already wounded foot keeps him indoors. He scrambles to untie his improvised rappeling rig -- get just before the hose nozzle CRASHES out and into the grea Winded, strength ebbing, he staggers to his feet -- just for:

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: to RECOIL from another staggering explosion!

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: They scream, cry out:

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: As Holly covers her head from falling plaster, the men wo like automatons, piling up the bonds.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: recovers from another AFTERSHOCK, runs up the steps -- is momentarily amazed to HEAR a "ding" from the elevator -- at:

dialogues.speaker: THE SHAFT
dialogues.text: where suddenly the WALL EXPLODES OUTWARD as an ENTIRE ELE CRASHES THROUGH THE WALL, swinging on its cable like a demolition ball on a crane!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane runs up the steps as brickwork flies past his hea schrapnel:

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: reaches the apex of its swing, drops down in an arcing tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the elevator CRASHES into the stairs!  The section McClan on SNAPS LOOSE!  At the last minute McClane LEAPS towards

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT FLOOR BALCONY
dialogues.text: and catches it as stairs and elevator CRUMBLE behind and him!  With his last effort, he hauls himself onto the bal and them moves off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are scrambling for cover.  Powell and Robinson open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Argyle is huddled down on the floor of the back seat, the animal held over his head as much for company as protecti As the building ceases to ROCK Argyle sneaks a peek out f under the fur...and sees:

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: at the delivery truck.  He steps into a white paramedic's jumpsuit and zips it up.  He hops into the cab and pulls truck away from the loading dock.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He creeps forward, looks carefully into:

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: They're getting ready to leave with the bearer bonds.  Su the CAMERA FOCUS CHANGES TO HOLLY.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McClane's face shows his anguish.  He checks the weapon h from Uli.  One bullet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... He checks his Baretta.  One bullet.  He thinks, desperate Decides.  He takes the bullet from the rifle clip, adds i the Baretta clip.  He slams the pistol clip back, really Mind racing, he looks all around the room...his eyes fall tape dispenser.  He thinks again...steps towards it:

dialogues.speaker: 380-A IN THE BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Theo has pulled two ramps out from the truck and slips in the back.  A car engine fires up inside the delivery truc

dialogues.speaker: ARGYLE
dialogues.text: Realization dawning, he vaults into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: THE GARAGE
dialogues.text: A paramedic van shoots out of the back of the Pacific Cou delivery truck.  Flooring the limo, Argyle CRASHES into the van, which CAREENS into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo staggers out in time for Argyle to deck him with one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the camera when you need them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move. The last of the money is piled on.  Hans hangs onto Holly Eddie pushes the mail carts of moneybags.  Kristoff goes door to scope their escape...suddenly he is COLD COCKED b rifle butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane steps into view in the doorway, backlit by sparks tumbling down from the roof above.  He holds the machine ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans! Hans turns, not that surprised.  Grinning, he yanks Holly view.  No words need be said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly, we have to stop meeting like this. (taking in the vault)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what it was.  A fucking robbery. (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why nuke the building, Hans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you steal six hundred dollars, you can disappear...but when you steal six hundred million, they will find you...unless you play dead. (tight smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which happens to be your next role... drop your gun, please. McClane hesitates...Hans pushes the gun against Holly aga really hurting her.  Eddie quickly raises his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nein, dies ein ist mein. (to McClane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time John Wayne does not walk off into the sunset with Grace Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Gary Cooper, shithead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more jokes, drop it or she gets it between the eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly putting down his gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Hans, now you're the cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Yippe-ki-yea, mother fucker'?  Now you are fucked. He aims:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly, now...! Instantly, Holly sidesteps, JABS her elbow into Hans' fac

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: At the same moment Holly moves, McClane grabs his Baretta from its hiding place TAPED TO THE BACK OF HIS NECK, SHOO Hans high in the chest! The bullet passes right THROUGH Hans, and the WINDOW behi him SPLATTERS with blood and SHATTERS.  Even while this i happening, McClane SPINS:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Eddie takes a gunshot, DROPS just like on Gunsmoke.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Hans drops his weapon, staggers, looks down at his own bl in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right about us Americans. (he blows smoke from his pistol barrel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Incredibly, Hans still stands, eyes filled with shock and disbelief.  He REELS, falls against the windowsill, start TOPPLE -- and then he GRITS his teeth and from some inwar place finds a last reserve of strength and he GRABS:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY'S WRIST
dialogues.text: and she is YANKED off her feet!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Hans goes out the window, pulling Holly with him!  McClan LEAPS forward, catches her inside arm near the elbow at t last minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof still in flames, McClane hangs halfway out of th window, jagged glass raking his face, straining to hold o Holly as Hans drags her out! McClane braces himself against the window frame and strai pull Holly closer.  With a MOAN, she catches the windowsi her inside hand.  McClane STRETCHES with his other hand, to INCH towards Holly's wristband.

dialogues.speaker: HANS' HAND
dialogues.text: A death grip on the watchband.  We WIDEN, SEE that, blood flecked teeth GRITTING, he is STRAINING with his other ha to bring up the gun he is still holding!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Holly's SCREAM alerts him.  Hans locks eyes with McClane last time, starts to pull the trigger, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane RELEASES the latch on the watchband!  The overtax metal SNAPS, links flying:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans' face registers his horror as he and most of the wat suddenly drop. We LISTEN to his scream all the way down, finally HEAR hi McClane pulls Holly back into the room and holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, babe.  It's okay. He looks down at Hans' body, then back at the scrap of wr he's still holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a warranty on this? She laughs through her tears, holds onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke drifts up from what has suddenly become the top flo Thornburg's remote truck careens into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd watches as the front doors of the building open. SEE McClane, who holds up Holly and in turn is supported SWAT men.  As REPORTERS start shouting questions, McClane breaks free of his entourage, and, holding Holly, pushes the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al?  Al, you here -- ? The crowd eddys and surges...suddenly Powell is there, an McClane knows it's him.  They stare at each other, ten fe apart, and then they're grinning, extending their hands. somehow a shake isn't enough, and they're embracing each like men who've lived through combat together...which, in is the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al.  Man, you were my rock.  I couldn't have made it without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.  Hey, this is my wife... Holly Gennero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Powell's hand, correcting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly McClane. Hearing this, McClane grins, pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure.  I guess John doesn't need me to give you that message anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message? McClane begins to make silent "ixney" gestures in Powell' direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, about him being such a jerk -- and how he's really sor -- (seeing McClane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ee...Uh, I'm sure he'll fill you in. Just then Robinson barges forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you for debrief, McClane. You've got some things to answer for -- Ellis' murder -- property damage -- interfering with police                    * business -- A SCREAM causes McClane to turn. 400     HIS P.O.V. There in the doorway is Karl, clothing and body scorched. Easily as crusted in dirt and blood as McClane, he holds machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd panics trying to escape, Karl locks eyes wit McClane and levels his gun.  McClane throws Holly to the ground and grabs the dumbstruck Robinson's sidearm. But he doesn't get off a shot -- a lone gunshot stops Kar knocking him back through the doorway.  McClane looks bac see Powell still sighting down the barrel of his .38. His hand is rock steady.  He sees McClane's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right.  You couldn't have made it without me. They smile.  Suddenly McClane and Holly squint as LIGHTS onto them.  Thornburg pushes his way forward, mike extend like a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McClane...Mrs. McClane...any comment on your incredible ordeal? What are your feelings now that it's all over? Without a beat, Holly PUNCHES HIM in the chops.  He FALLS dropping the mike with an electronic SQUEAL.  McClane loo his wife, amazed.  Behind them, Thornburg sits on the gro nurses his lip, turns to his camerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager)                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get that? McClane and Holly continue on, turn towards:

dialogues.speaker: ARGYLE'S LIMO
dialogues.text: It's a little smashed up, but still running.  Argyle is standing beside the open door.  McClane and Holly get in Argyle closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in the front)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is their idea of Christmas I gotta be there for New Year's. CAMERA ADJUSTS TO SHOW the read window where McClane and Holly are kissing.  As they drive off, we:
